title: Senior Backend Developer (Node.js)
description:
**About Us:** 




 Letterlife is a pioneering app designed to empower women with ADHD. By integrating science-backed insights and personalized strategies, we offer an evidence-based approach to enhance the well-being and success of neurodiverse women. Our platform provides the best combination of medication, education, and practical tools, supporting our users in reclaiming control and transforming their lives.
 



  





 We're backed by leading financiers who believe in our mission, and with their support, we are scaling rapidly. Letterlife is at an exciting stage of growth, allowing us to innovate swiftly while expanding our reach to women who need our solution the most. We are committed to making a positive impact on the lives of millions of women worldwide, and this is just the beginning.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are looking for a passionate and experienced backend developer to join our fast-growing team. You will be responsible for developing and maintaining a scalable backend structure for our app, ensuring our technology evolves to meet the needs of our rapidly expanding user base. As we continue to grow, you will play a critical role in building a secure, efficient, and high-performing platform that empowers women around the world.
 



  





  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Design, build, and maintain efficient, reusable, and reliable Node.js code
* Develop scalable backend architecture to support a growing number of users and features
* Implement security and data protection measures
* Optimize the application for maximum speed and scalability
* Collaborate with the team to define and implement new features
* Troubleshoot and debug applications to ensure optimal performance and reliability
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies, recommending and implementing improvements to our tech stack



**Requirements:** 



* 5+ years of relevant software development experience, with a strong focus on Node.js
* Proven experience in building scalable backend systems and APIs
* Strong understanding of database design and management (SQL and NoSQL)
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud)
* Knowledge of microservices architecture and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
* Proficiency in version control tools such as Git
* Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude
* Strong communication skills



**Preferred Qualifications:** 



* A degree in Computer Science or a related field is preferred, but not mandatory
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines
* Experience working in startups or fast-paced environments



**What We Offer:** 



* An easy-going, inclusive and professional environment
* Tools of your choice
* Nordic level salary with 5 weeks annual paid vacation
* Flexible working hours and the option for remote work.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* Stock option program



  





 If you are passionate about technology and making a positive impact, we would love to hear from you! Join us at Letterlife in creating a space where women feel understood, supported, and empowered.
 



  





**How to Apply:** 




 Please submit your resume, portfolio, and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and interest in this role. Email hakan@letterlife.se and be sure to include “Senior Backend Developer” in the subject line.
 



 Read more about us at https://letterlife.se
 



*Letterlife is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences.* 




*Letterlife is an equal opportunity employer.*

title: C#/.NET Developer with Experience in Autodesk Software
description:
We are seeking a skilled and dedicated developer with expertise in C# and .NET for an exciting project at a growing company in the technology sector. You will be working on developing specialized solutions connected to the AutoCAD platform.
 



  





**Your Role:** 




  




* Develop and maintain software solutions for a CAD environment, with significant responsibility for the entire development process.
* Work closely with product owners to translate requirements into functional code, while having the freedom to propose and implement your own ideas and solutions.
* Participate in technical discussions and play a key role in improving architecture and code quality.
* Perform testing and debugging to ensure high performance and user-friendliness, with the opportunity to leave your own mark on the solution.



  





**We are looking for someone who:** 




  




* Has solid experience with C# and .NET.
* Has experience working with Autodesk software, preferably AutoCAD or similar tools.
* Is accustomed to working independently and taking initiative, but also works well in a team.
* Has an analytical and problem solving mindset and a keen eye for detail.



  





**Preferred Qualifications:** 




  




* Experience in developing plugins or extensions for AutoCAD software.
* Knowledge of database management (SQL) and integration of external systems.
* Experience with agile development methods.



  





**What We Offer:** 




  




* A dynamic work environment with the opportunity to work on innovative technical solutions.
* Flexibility in work hours and location, with the possibility of remote work.
* Opportunities for growth and development within a company that invests in future technologies.



  





 If you are a driven developer who wants to be part of an innovative project, we look forward to your application!

title: Senior Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
**Join Scratx and Build the Future of Financial Operations**
 Are you a kickass fullstack engineer looking to make a significant impact in a rapidly growing startup? Do you thrive on building future-proof technology with no legacy constraints?
   

  

 If you're excited about creating the next generation financial data processing and operations automation platform for high-volume transaction businesses, we want to hear from you.
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 Scratx, founded in 2023, is on a mission to liberate financial operations in digital, e-commerce, and retail businesses. Our goal is to empower companies with greater freedom and independence through self-serve, no-code tools that streamline transaction data harmonization and automate repetitive tasks like revenue recognition, payment reconciliation, and tax reporting.
   

  

 At Scratx, we value experimentation, creativity, and a shared ambition to build something truly great. We believe in creating delightful customer experiences while enjoying the process of building a business and innovative products.
   

  

 Learn more about us at scratx.com/about-scratx.
   

  

**Who You Are:**
* A skilled fullstack software engineer with a proven track record in software development (including hobby projects and education).
* Experienced in building backend applications and working with system integrations through APIs.
* Experienced in building frontend user friendly interfaces.
* Experienced in working with commonly used frameworks for platform development such as C#, C++, .NET, React, Typescript, Python, PostgreSQL, Docker, Kubernetes, Jenkins etc.
* Preferably you've worked with applications that depend on large datasets and high-speed processing power.
* Ambitious, with a long-term vision for your work and a desire to join a startup committed to building future-proof technology.
* Experience from working in startups and / or B2B SaaS businesses is highly preferred.
* Open-minded, kind-hearted, and full of energy.
* Clear about your professional goals and values, and able to communicate them authentically.


**What You’ll Do:**
* Build core applications and features, both backend and frontend, on our platform from scratch, leveraging the latest and/or best frameworks available open source or as a service.
* Collaborate closely with the CTO and development team on platform architecture design.
* Build new generation AI features, integrating to LLMs, both operating backend and deployed frontend in the Scratx user interface.


**What We Offer:**
* The opportunity to join an early-stage startup and have a significant impact, with the freedom to experiment and innovate alongside a driven team.
* A competitive salary, appropriate for a startup environment.
* Equity opportunities: Option packages will be available for key team members with long-term commitment.
* A hybrid work model, with a required base in Sweden.


 Questions before you apply? Reach out to hello@scratx.com

title: Frontend Developer
description:
**Är du den vi söker?** 




 Vill du vara med och utveckla en webbplats i världsklass för nästan 3 miljoner kunder?
 



  





**Arbetsbeskrivning** 




 Vi söker dig som vill utveckla Alectas publika och inloggade webbplatser. I det dagliga kommer du att arbeta nära och tillsammans med visuella designers, UX-designers, backendutvecklare och testare som tillsammans med verksamheten skapar de bästa lösningarna där kvalitet och kundens användarupplevelse står i fokus.
 



 Du samarbetar med vårt designteam för att säkerställa att designidéer förverkligas och har en förmåga att arbeta utifrån detaljerade designspecifikationer.
 



  





**Teamet** 




 Vi är ett engagerat, kompetent och lösningsorienterat team med vana att hantera en snabbrörlig omvärld med komplexa utmaningar där teknik och användarupplevelse möts. Vår utgångspunkt i all utveckling är våra kunder. Vi lever efter våra agila principer, utmanar varandra och vårt arbetssätt för att tillsammans genomföra värdeskapande förändring. Tillsammans har vi skapat en positiv och konstruktiv atmosfär.
 



 Vi jobbar med CMS-verktygen Umbraco och Optimizely/EPiServer och för våra inloggade webbar jobbar vi med ASP.NET och MVC för backend.
 



 Teamet ingår i Alectas verksamhetsutveckling och arbetar inom det agila ramverket SAFe.
 



  





**Din profil** 




 Vi söker dig som är nyfiken och som har en naturlig fallenhet för att skapa ett estetiskt tilltalande och användbart användargränssnitt. Du är van att ta eget ansvar och bidrar noggrant och strukturerat med teknisk kompetens till teamet. Du är lyhörd, prestigelös och van att samarbeta med teamets olika discipliner och har en tro på det agila arbetssättet. Vidare är du kommunikativ och svensktalande.
 



 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du har en högskoleutbildning i systemvetenskap, ingenjör eller annan för tjänsten relevant utbildning.
 



 Du har:
 



 · Mycket goda kunskaper inom semantisk HTML, CSS (Scss) och JavaScript och implementering av design och anpassning till mallar/templates
 



 · Erfarenhet av att skapa webbplatser som bygger på CMS-verktyg såsom EpiServer eller Umbraco
 



 · Erfarenhet av iterativt samarbete nära visuella designers och UX-designers samt användning av designprogram som till exempel Figma
 



 · Kunskap om tillgänglighet, prestanda och andra best practices inom frontendutveckling
 



 · Erfarenhet av att arbeta med versionshanteringssystem som Git
 



  





**Om företaget** 




 Vi strävar efter att alltid bli bättre och värdesätter våra medarbetares initiativ och vill ge dig chansen att växa hos oss. Vi sitter i stora, fina lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Vi vill att du ska må bra och erbjuder därför goda möjligheter till balans i livet. Som anställd hos oss har du möjlighet
 



 till en del distansarbete och du får generösa friskvårdsförmåner, tillgång till träningslokaler på jobbet, lunchsubvention och mycket mer.
 



 Alecta är förvaltare av tjänstepension sedan 1917. Vårt uppdrag är att ge kollektivavtalade tjänstepensioner så stort värde som möjligt för både våra företags- och privatkunder. Det gör vi genom god avkastning, bra kundservice och låga kostnader. Vi förvaltar mer än 1 200 miljarder kronor åt våra ägare som är 2,8 miljoner privatkunder och 35 000 företagskunder.
 



  





**Ansök enkelt med ditt CV** 




 På Inhouse rekryterar vi kompetensbaserat för en mer rättvis process. Du ansöker därför enkelt med ditt CV här direkt på hemsidan. Vi önskar inte ett personligt brev och du kan inte heller söka via mail.
 



  





 Efter att du skickat in din ansökan kommer du få tydlig återkoppling på hur rekryteringsprocessen ser ut framåt. Om du går vidare kommer du t ex som ett första steg få svara på ett antal urvalsfrågor. Processen innehåller även arbetspsykologiska tester. Intervjuer sker löpande, så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt!
 



  





 I denna rekrytering samarbetar vi med Inhouse AB. Vid frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryteringskonsult Louise Hagen Furugård, louise.furugard@inhouse.se alt 0733118726
 



 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Frontend Developer till IT Customer and Accounts
description:
**I rollen får du:**
* Skapa värde för våra produkter och kunder
* Jobba med fantastiska medarbetare i en lärande och utvecklande miljö
* Flexibelt arbete och balans i livet


 Vi söker nu en frontend-utvecklare till IT customer and accounts. Vi jobbar med centrala applikationer i ATG:s miljö inom områdena martech, fair play, anti money laundry & payment, så det är en fördel om du trivs med att jobba i komplexa, transaktionstunga miljöer. Gör du det så välkomnas du till ett team som har kul tillsammans och som tror på öppenhet och transparens i arbetet. Vi jobbar blandat på kontoret och hemifrån, men har daglig kontakt i teamet och samarbetar även tvärfunktionellt med andra team inom IT.
   

  

**Är det här du?**
 Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper och för att lyckas i rollen ser vi att du som söker har några års arbetslivserfarenhet inom frontend-utveckling. Vidare ser vi att du är nyfiken, prestigelös och gillar att dela med dig av din kunskap. Det är viktigt att du är en teamspelare som har en god samarbetsförmåga. Du bör även ha en god kommunikativ förmåga på både engelska och svenska. Meriterande är om du har erfarenhet av och intresse för backend-utveckling samt app-utveckling och skulle vilja gå mot att bli fullstack-utvecklare på sikt. För att lyckas i denna roll ser vi att du känner till arbete med agila metoder och värdesätter teamarbete men även eget ansvar. Vidare ser vi att du gillar att hålla dig uppdaterad om och är nyfiken på att lära dig nya tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har erfarenhet av:
   

  

* React
* Typescript
* GraphQL
* Redux
* Redux Saga
* React Native
* HTML
* CSS


**"För mig är det bästa med ATG att det är en otroligt inkluderande arbetsplats. Ett brett samarbete och en närvarande och synlig ledning som bryr sig om och lyssnar till sina medarbetare”**
 Jag är en engagerad ledare som drivs av att se människor och organisationer utvecklas. Jag litar på mina medarbetare fullt ut. De är experterna, och jag finns där för att stötta och skapa så bra förutsättningar som möjligt för att alla ska kunna göra ett bra jobb och trivas på arbetsplatsen. Jag har arbetat med IT sen början av 00-talet, men är själv inte tekniskt utbildad, istället finns mina styrkor i ledarskapet och organisationsutvecklingen. För mig är det bästa med ATG att det är en otroligt inkluderande arbetsplats. Ett brett samarbete och en närvarande och synlig ledning som bryr sig om och lyssnar till sina medarbetare.
   

  

* Lisa Oldmar, Manager IT Customer and Accounts


**We are the game**
 I närmare 50 år har vi på ATG levererat spänning och underhållning till svenska folket. Vi drivs av att trygga den svenska hästnäringen och att fortsatt vara ett ansvarsfullt spelbolag i framkant. Vår vision att leverera världens bästa spelupplevelse. Hos oss är du en del av en innovativ miljö – med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar vi spelupplevelser i världsklass. Självledarskap och kompetensutveckling är viktiga delar för oss. Sedan starten 1974 har vi byggt och förvaltat systemen för våra produkter som hanterar 4 500 000 transaktioner per dag.
   

  

**Join the game!**
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan via vår rekryteringsportal antingen med ditt cv eller din LinkedIn-profil – det som är enklast och smidigast för dig. Läs gärna mer om oss på vår karriärsida och tveka inte att höra av dig om du har frågor om tjänsten.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning och kommer att göra en bakgrundskontroll för denna roll. Tjänsten är på heltid och utgår från vårt kontor vid Solvalla, alldeles intill travbanan. Vi har ett flexibelt arbetssätt vilket innebär att du har möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete från kontoret. Var med och bygg världens bästa spelupplevelse tillsammans med oss!
   

  

 Vi har riktigt bra förmåner
   

  

* Occupational pension
* Tjänstepension
* Work-life balance
* Personal trainer and gym facilities at the office
* Personlig tränare och gym på kontoret
* Wellness allowance
* Friskvård
* Fri parkering
* Free parking
* Hund på jobbet
* Dog at the office


 Om företaget
   

  

**Så här har vi det** 
 Hos oss är du del av en innovativ miljö och med hjälp av den senaste tekniken utvecklar du den bästa spelupplevelsen. Vi gillar att samarbeta och hos oss får du stort utrymme att påverka ditt arbetssätt. Här hittar du nyfikna, nytänkande medarbetare och ledare – viktiga egenskaper för att kunna utveckla och utvecklas. Liksom energi , mod och motivation.
   

  

 För att må bra är skrattmuskeln lika viktig att träna som alla andra muskler. Både den fysiska och den mentala hälsan skapar balans i livet. Hur vi har det på jobbet påverkar privatlivet- och vice versa. Vi ser det som en självklarhet att ge det stöd och de verktyg som behövs. Ditt val av arbetsplats och arbetssätt är flexibelt och vi lägger stor vikt på självledarskap.
   

  

 Vi bryr oss om varandra och respekterar varandras olikheter på ATG. Och vi vill att våra kunder ska må bra och ha roligt när de spelar. Vi bryr oss också om sportens välmående, dvs. idrottarna och hästarna - och samhället runt omkring oss. Vi drivs inte av privata vinstintressen utan allt överskott går tillbaka till våra ägare, svensk trav- och galoppsport, något som både känns och gör gott.

title: Software Architect
description:
Do you want to create new tools and features that support the future needs and requirements of Scania production? Do you want to be part of our journey of migrating a monolithic system to a cloud? If you also have experience in architecting technical solutions in a complex IT landscape, please read more and don’t hesitate to apply!
   

  

 Scania is now undergoing an exciting transformation from being a supplier of trucks, buses and engines to a supplier of complete and sustainable transport solutions.
   

  

**The team**
 You will be part of a competent and ambitious team, that works agile and with close contact with the customers. The team works closely together to deliver value for Scania production units globally. The applications delivered by the team are tools used for both configuring and testing the Electronic Control Units (ECU) and for testing the whole electrical system in the vehicles.
   

  

 The competence mix in the team is ranging from development to architecture and device management and together with our users in production and colleagues from R&D we form a whole eco-system within the quality assurance of the Automotive Electronics area at Scania.
   

  

 In our roadmap we have a vast number of interesting assignments coming up ahead. Some examples are development of cloud services in AWS, introduce support for a Chinese production unit and increasing our collaboration within TRATON.
   

  

**Your mission**
 You will be an important part of our development team and its goal to create new tools and features that support the future needs and requirements of Scania production. The team is also responsible for maintaining and keeping the current solution operational over time. That will require a thorough understanding of the implemented solution, as well as the ability to understand the customer business and our solutions effect on their daily work.
   

  

 Our day to day operations consists of complex system structures and a variety of third party systems, which we connect and harvest data from. We thrive to leverage digitalization to maximize efficiency and minimize waste for the clients and other key stakeholders.
   

  

**Your profile**
 You enjoy working in close contact with customers and colleagues, and you are skilled at communicating and thereby creating a solid foundation for value creation. Your agile mindset allows you to stay focused when tackling challenging tasks or working in demanding environment. You have an interest in software architecture and how IT can impact our products. Furthermore, we believe you have;
   

  

  

* experience in architecting technical solutions in a complex IT landscape
* the ability to drive technical and organizational change as part of a digital transformation journey
* modeling experience, capable of developing different views at different levels, from simple to complex depending on the need and audience.
* Have a senior developer background with experience in developing .NET C# applications, adapted for both desktop applications developed with WPF and for web applications developed with ASP.NET MVC. Knowledge of the automotive industry is an advantage but not a must.
* Great communication and presentation skills in English


 For you to have fun and thrive in this position we believe you are a curious person who stays up-to-date on industry trends, new technologies and is receptive to new ideas and influences. you have a pragmatic & positive mindset and enjoys networking & collaborations rather than working by yourself.
   

  

**We offer**
 A dynamic workplace with varied and challenging work assignments. We focus on a collaborative environment where everyone participates in driving the development forward. As a new employee, you will receive the full backing and support from all team members
   

  

**Application**
 If the above sounds interesting please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Note that a background check might be conducted for this position.
   

  

 For more information about the role please contact Caroline Pousette, Hiring Manager e-mail: caroline.pousette@scania.com

title: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 8, C#, Azure, JavaScript, Agile – Stockholm
description:
**.NET Software Engineer, .NET 8, C#, Azure, JavaScript, Agile – Stockholm, Sweden** 




  





 (Tech stack: .NET Software Engineer, .NET 8, ASP.NET, C#, React, Angular 17, Microservices, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, Web API 2, Agile, SQL Server 2022, Programmer, Full Stack Developer, Architect, .NET Software Engineer, Urgent)
 







 Be the first of your friends to declare, “I love where I work!” and actually mean it. Laugh hard and work hard with some of the best and brightest in the tech industry. Our client has created the world’s first marketplace for live experiences by developing the technology that lets anyone create, share and find new things to do. Currently 180 countries host events using their platform, with over 1.5 million events taking place every year and 5 million tickets being processed every month!

They have been extremely picky about assembling a team of smart, humble people who are passionate about creating amazing products. They work in an agile manner and believe strongly that small cross-functional teams empowered to make decisions and move fast is the best way to work. This is an unbeatable opportunity for .NET Software Engineer who hope to work on and deliver world class software in a friendly, fun, and innovative environment.
 



  





 The ideal .NET Software Engineer candidates should have strong experience with: .NET, .NET Core / ASP.NET MVC, C# and SQL Server. Our client will provide you with industry recognised training into: .NET 8, JavaScript, React, Angular 17, Microservices, MongoDB, Vue.js, TypeScript, Azure, AWS, Web API 2, Entity Framework, Node.js, Elasticsearch, Agile, TDD, BDD, Scrum, Kanban and SQL Server 2022.
 



  





 Their benefits include the following:

* Generous stock option plan.

 Applicants must be based in Sweden and have the right to work in Sweden even though remote working is available.

title: Senior Developer
description:
Do you want to help secure digital assets worldwide? We are looking for a Senior Developer who will play a key role in our goal to become the leading cybersecurity company in Europe.
 



  





  





**About the Role** 




 As a Senior Developer, you will participate in the design, development, and maintenance of efficient, reusable, and reliable software, both for new products and new features in existing products. You will create new features for the Net iD series, including Net iD Client and Net iD Portal, and write libraries and tools to make new features available for higher-level applications.
 



  





  





**About You** 



* You have at least 5 years of experience writing software in C++.
* Experience developing integrations and working with different operating systems.
* Experience or knowledge in cryptography and cybersecurity.
* Ability to work independently and in teams, take initiative, and collaborate effectively with others.
* Fluent in both Swedish and English.



  





**Additional Merits** 



* Knowledge of C#, Java, or similar high-level languages.
* Experience in developing, designing, and testing new features for software products.
* Ability to write libraries and tools for higher-level applications.



  





**We Offer** 



* A culture that values community and entrepreneurship, with a strong focus on technology and innovation.
* Regular group activities and attractive benefits.
* A varied and exciting workday with great opportunities for personal and professional growth. Short decision-making processes and significant opportunities for development within your role and the company.
* We offer a hybrid working model.
* A dynamic and international work environment in newly built offices in Sickla, with panoramic views of the area.



  





**About Pointsharp** 




 Pointsharp is a European cybersecurity company founded in 2006. Pointsharp delivers specialized software and services that help organizations secure identities, authorization, access, and data in a user-friendly manner. We believe that easy-to-use security solutions are the foundation of a secure, modern digital workplace.
 



  





  





**Application** 




 In this recruitment, Pointsharp is collaborating with HCM Partner AB. For questions, contact Stina Lönnroth at stina@hcmpartner.se / 073-862 96 49. The selection process and interviews will begin immediately. We look forward to receiving your application!

title: Business Intelligence Developer, Jigsaw (Remote) - $100,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 The software industry is rapidly evolving, driven by the demand for more immediate, actionable insights. Traditional business intelligence tools often fall short in delivering the speed and depth of analysis that clients require in a fast-paced, data-driven environment. Businesses that can’t keep up with this demand risk losing out to competitors who are more agile and technologically advanced. Our approach to this challenge is to merge cutting-edge AI with proven BI tools to create a new breed of business intelligence solutions. By integrating generative AI into platforms like Tableau and Alteryx, we’re transforming them into powerful, predictive tools that can significantly enhance client satisfaction and drive business success.
   

  

 This role is not for someone looking to simply run complex data models or stay behind the scenes. It’s about practical application—using AI and BI to build data visualizations and pipelines that are as reliable as they are innovative. Unlike a data scientist role, which might focus more on theoretical models, this position demands a deep understanding of client needs and a commitment to turning those needs into tangible, high-quality solutions. This is a client-centric role where your ability to consult, advise, and deliver will set you apart.
   

  

 At Jigsaw you will be joining a team at the forefront of AI-enhanced business intelligence, where your contributions will directly influence the direction of the industry. If you’re passionate about pushing the boundaries of what’s possible with AI and BI, and you thrive in a dynamic, client-focused environment, this is the opportunity to make a real impact.
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Data Visualization Creation: Producing Tableau dashboards and other data visualization outputs for clients
* Data Pipeline Development: Building and enhancing data workflows using Alteryx
* Client Consultation: Engaging with clients to define requirements, provide recommendations, and ensure that our solutions meet their business needs


**Business Intelligence Developer Key Responsibilities**
* Use AI to accelerate the delivery of business intelligence solutions and significantly improve client satisfaction


**Basic Requirements**
* Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
* At least 5 years of professional experience delivering complex BI projects
* Expertise in Tableau and Alteryx
* Professional experience using generative AI tools to speed up BI processes
* Professional experience translating technical information into non-technical business language that customers can easily understand


**About Jigsaw**
 Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsaw’s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment – helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizations’ success.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $50 USD/hour, which equates to $100,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5409-SE-Stockhol-BusinessIntell2

title: Senior Backend Developer
description:
**Join Qvik to create innovative digital solutions for top clients in a supportive, low-hierarchy culture with competitive pay, great benefits, and plenty of growth opportunities.** 




  





 Before diving deep into the back-end,
 **a few things you should know about Qvik** 
 : we are elbow-deep in the consultancy business, but above all in the people business. We create digital solutions for millions of end users every day by doing design, development and consulting with our clients. And not just any clients, but the most desirable ones in the consumer market, such as
 **Electrolux** 
 ,
 **Spotify** 
 and
 **Swedbank Pay** 
 to name just a few.
 



  





 Our international community consists of 170+ designers, developers, and consultants based in Stockholm and Helsinki. We are not a typical top-down corporation but an inclusive work community where every individual can affect how we roll.
 



  





**Now to the back-end:** 
 Some years ago, our developers noted that our customers’ back-ends were not as good as they could be, and thus began our journey to the cloud. Today, we have 15+ back-end engineers advising customers on technology choices and tackling the most complex technical challenges in their projects.
 



  





 You will work with infrastructure, microservices, LLMs and scalable systems to help our clients build payment systems, efficient data pipelines, and cloud adoptions, among other things. The work is done in our customers’ development teams, usually together with other Qvikies. The end products you are working with are something you would be proud to show to your family and friends – products you want to use yourself.
 



  





 We don’t deliver off-the-shelf tricks, but build new solutions from scratch to meet our customers' demands. So you will work more with cutting-edge software and less with the darkest back-end legacy – joy!
 



  





**Who are we looking for?** 




 Technically speaking, our back-end engineers are skilled in
 **Java** 
 ,
 **.NET** 
 ,
 **Python, Kubernetes** 
 and
 **Docker** 
 on top of
 **AWS, Azure** 
 or
 **GCP** 
 . We are looking for professionals who have experience (+10 years) of building cool stuff with some of these technologies. Besides experience with modern cloud platforms, we also value the ability to build CI/CD pipelines and automate cloud deployments. But, as a seasoned techie, you already know that amazing code is just one side of the coin. Furthermore, we would be happy to see you take on a lead role as a team lead or technical lead. Currently, we are searching for pros who are comfortable working in
 **Swedish** 
 as well as
 **English** 
 .
 



  





 The people you work with will be from different backgrounds and have different strengths. This means that we cherish a culture of open-mindedness, equality and empathy toward all people.
 



  





**Our offer** 




 We want to care more. We are focusing on creating an even more inspiring and safe culture, learning by doing, deepening our professionalism, and building an even stronger community.
 



  





 But perks and promises won’t pay the bills. The salary for this position will be somewhere
 **between 60 000 and 70 000 SEK** 
**/month + bonuses** 
 , depending on your skills and experience.
 



  





**Our standard benefits package is also pretty nice:** 
 a good pension plan, sports allowance of 5000 SEK per year. We also offer occupational health care with extra health insurance, travel and accident insurance and many company-supported sports and hobby opportunities with other Qvikies.
 



  





 Supporting the Qvikies' health and work-life balance is essential for us. We also offer sick-child care services for smoother sailing over the flu season, as well as personal support for life challenges via the Auntie service. And don't forget the community glue, aka parties – we are pretty good at setting up some jams, too :)
 



  





 In addition, we offer a low-hierarchy culture, flexible working hours, plenty of projects with opportunities for growth, learning, and so much more.
 



  





**OK, what next?** 




 If you want to learn more about working at Qvik, get in touch with Jonas Frid at jonas.frid@qvik.com.
 



  





 \*Please apply through our recruitment system to ensure that all personal information is handled appropriately.

title: Säljare - partnership developer
description:
Vi jobbar nära våra kunder och skräddarsyr system, produkter och tjänster för våra kunder och Bitio gruppens egna SaaS produkter. Vi befinner oss i en spännande tillväxtfas med ett starkt team och hög kundnöjdhet. Vi jobbar och levererar som team och tar oss an hela projekt och jobbar med långsiktigt partnerskap med våra kunder. Vi månar om både för våra medarbetare och kunder, vilket genomsyrar allt vi gör. Vi är stolta över att bygga system som håller över tid och att utveckla långsiktiga, förtroendefulla relationer med våra kunder.
 




  





**Om rollen:** 





 Vi söker nu en driven säljare som vill vara med på vår fortsatta tillväxtresa. Du kommer att ingå i ett nytt team, där du tillsammans med head of partnership och vår VD fokuserar på att hitta och utveckla nya affärer. I denna roll kommer prospektering och nykundsbearbetning vara centrala delar av dina arbetsuppgifter.
 





 Du förväntas identifiera och paketera nya affärsmöjligheter, samt bidra med utveckling i försäljningsprocessen. Du är bekväm i behovsanalysen och vill förstå kundernas verksamhet på en djupare nivå för att kunna erbjuda skräddarsydda lösningar utifrån deras behov.
 




  





**Din profil:** 





 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet av nykundsbearbetning inom B2B och är van att arbeta självgående och målinriktat. Du har ett naturligt driv och tar gärna initiativ till att utveckla och forma dina förutsättningar. Din erfarenhet och passion för försäljning gör dig till en värdefull tillgång för vårt team, och du är engagerad i att hjälpa Bitio att nå nya framgångar.
 




  





**Krav:** 



* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av B2B-försäljning med dokumenterade goda resultat.
* Kunskap och intresse för digitalisering och teknik
* Vana vid att arbeta självständigt och driva egna affärer.
* Stark ansvarskänsla och ett genuint engagemang för dina kunder.
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift.



  





**Vad vi erbjuder:** 



* Härliga medarbetare och representativt kontor
* Goda förutsättningar att göra ett väldigt bra jobb
* Stor frihet och ansvar
* Tjänstepension, generöst friskvårdsbidrag, hälsopeng och extra semesterdagar ("Bitio-bjussdagar").
* Flexibelt hybridupplägg med två gemensamma dagar på kontoret i Gamla Stan, Stockholm.



  





**Plats:** 

 Stockholm, Munkbron - Gamla Stan
 




**Start:** 

 Enligt överenskommelse
 




  






 Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!

title: Developer SME on AWS
description:
**Role Name:** 
 Developer
 



  





**Role Description:** 




 We are seeking a skilled Developer to join our team and contribute to achieving our Cloud strategy and roadmap milestones. The ideal candidate will:
 


* Serve as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud platform.
* Stay updated with the latest AWS cloud services, features, and capabilities, and evaluate their applicability to business needs.
* Help the team automate processes related to cloud operations, security configuration, account management, and cost optimization.
* Promote the Public Cloud offering internally to stakeholders.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and business units to understand requirements, prioritize initiatives, and align cloud strategies with business objectives.
* Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to junior architects, engineers, and developers, fostering a culture of innovation, learning, and continuous improvement.



  





**Competencies:** 




 Digital: Amazon Web Service (AWS) Cloud Computing
 



  





**Experience (Years):** 




 8-10 years
 



  





**Essential Skills:** 



* Deep knowledge of AWS, including a deep understanding of platform services, features, and best practices.
* Ability to build scalable, resilient, and cost-effective cloud platform solutions based on business requirements and industry best practices, adhering to security and compliance standards.
* Experience with Cloud Foundations constructs for enterprises, such as AWS Control Tower and Cloud Adoption Framework.
* Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and container orchestration platforms such as Kubernetes.
* Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Terraform and AWS CloudFormation templates to provision and manage cloud resources programmatically.
* Use of Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) pipelines at scale.
* Proficiency in Go and Python, as these languages are extensively used on our team to build serverless integrations and APIs.
* Fluent with best practices for software development, with a passion for automation.
* Excellent communication skills, with well-spoken and written English.



  





**Desirable Skills:** 



* Knowledge of other cloud platforms like GCP or Azure.
* Ability to translate strategic plans into technical deliverables, including operational readiness and stability.
* FinOps skills, including Cloud Economics, Cost Optimization, and Cost Visualization.
* Practical experience with security and networking.
* Looking for only EU and NATO citizens.

title: Embedded Application Developer | Digital Experience Platform
description:
**Create moments that matter. Decode the future.**
 At the Electrolux Group, a leading global appliance company, we strive every day to shape living for the better for our consumers, our people and our planet. We share ideas and collaborate so that together, we can develop solutions that deliver enjoyable and sustainable living.
   

  

 Come join us as you are. We believe diverse perspectives make us stronger and more innovative. In our global community of people from 100+ countries, we listen to each other, actively contribute, and grow together.
   

  

**We’re looking for Embedded Application Developer to join us on our journey.**
**What you'll do:**
 Join the team developing Electrolux’s next generation digital appliances. Build the user experience of our future appliance UIs and connected ecosystem. Work closely with the cross functional team to bring new consumer experiences from concept to launch with updates throughout product lifecycle. Bring the technical excellence and collaboration skills we need in the heart of our digital transformation.
   

  

**In detail, you will:**
* Develop software using a pragmatic and modern embedded tech stack for connected appliances, with a primary focus on the logic needed to control and optimize how the appliance capabilities can be utilized to provide the best possible user experience.
* Ship small reliable frequent releases of production grade software together with the rest of the team.
* Wrap every release with a proper test coverage. You build it you own it.
* Work closely with Engineering Lead in order enhance and improve infra and CI/CD setup.
* Create and maintain modularized software that is scalable to different product capabilities, compute capabilities, brands, and markets.
* Work together with other developers, testers, designers, and product managers with shared responsibility for the teams’ success.


**Who you are:**
* You have 3+ years experience in developing application code for embedded devices.
* You have experience in developing software applications for embedded internet devices that are frequently updated in production.
* You have experience in developing high abstraction level code with significant use of existing frameworks in Python, Rust or C++ for embedded devices.
* You need to master at least two of the following competence areas and quickly learn what good looks like for the others:
+ Layered software architecture for embedded systems with different chipset performance and configurable capabilities.
+ Modular test automation for application logic in embedded products.
+ Simulation and sandbox technology for rapid software development of embedded products.
+ Build pipeline, code analysis, feature flag and analytics tools for modern embedded development.
+ Service based architectures and pub/sub patterns used in multi-threaded embedded execution.


**Where you'll be:**
 At our Global Headquarters in Stockholm/Stadshagen (Sweden) we are 60+ nationalities under the same roof and we enjoy the look and feel of the office!
   

  

 You will be part of a dynamic international team where English is the natural language.
   

  

**Benefits highlights:**
* Flexible work hours/hybrid work environment
* Discounts on our award-winning Electrolux products and services
* Family friendly benefits
* Insurance policy plan
* Extensive learning opportunities and flexible career path


**As part of Electrolux, we will continuously invest in you and your development. There are no barriers to where your career could take you.**
 For more information go to www.electroluxgroup.com.

title: Senior iOS Developer • Product Library
description:
**The Company**
 PayPal has been revolutionizing commerce globally for more than 25 years. Creating innovative experiences that make moving money, selling, and shopping simple, personalized, and secure, PayPal empowers consumers and businesses in approximately 200 markets to join and thrive in the global economy.
   

  

 We operate a global, two-sided network at scale that connects hundreds of millions of merchants and consumers. We help merchants and consumers connect, transact, and complete payments, whether they are online or in person. PayPal is more than a connection to third-party payment networks. We provide proprietary payment solutions accepted by merchants that enable the completion of payments on our platform on behalf of our customers.
   

  

 We offer our customers the flexibility to use their accounts to purchase and receive payments for goods and services, as well as the ability to transfer and withdraw funds. We enable consumers to exchange funds more safely with merchants using a variety of funding sources, which may include a bank account, a PayPal or Venmo account balance, PayPal and Venmo branded credit products, a credit card, a debit card, certain cryptocurrencies, or other stored value products such as gift cards, and eligible credit card rewards. Our PayPal, Venmo, and Xoom products also make it safer and simpler for friends and family to transfer funds to each other. We offer merchants an end-to-end payments solution that provides authorization and settlement capabilities, as well as instant access to funds and payouts. We also help merchants connect with their customers, process exchanges and returns, and manage risk. We enable consumers to engage in cross-border shopping and merchants to extend their global reach while reducing the complexity and friction involved in enabling cross-border trade.
   

  

 Our beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. We live each day guided by our core values of Inclusion, Innovation, Collaboration, and Wellness. Together, our values ensure that we work together as one global team with our customers at the center of everything we do – and they push us to ensure we take care of ourselves, each other, and our communities.
   

  

**Job Description Summary:**
 As PayPal continues its mission to revolutionize commerce, we're seeking a creative and experienced iOS Developer to join our Product Library Team in Stockholm. In this role, you'll collaborate with a crowd of bright minds dedicated to creating and maintaining a high-quality product library on iOS and Android POS apps. If this already sparks your interest, keep reading – the best is yet to come!
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Meet our team**
 As part of our Point of Sale Alliance, our Product Library Team's mission is to develop the fastest and most intuitive product and inventory management tool, enabling our merchants to save time and increase profits. By joining us, you'll collaborate with a diverse group of passionate professionals, including Product Managers, Mobile Developers, QAs, and more.
   

  

**Your way to impact**
 As you step into this position, you'll join a talented team committed to helping Everyday Sellers streamline their operations and boost profits through our cutting-edge product and inventory management tools. Your contribution will be key in developing innovative solutions and crafting tailored user experiences for our merchants.
   

  

 Additionally, you'll have plenty of opportunities to work closely with various teams and iOS developers throughout our entire iOS Chapter. This will involve engaging in code reviews, brainstorming sessions, mob programming (which we're big fans of), participating in our hack-weeks to launch disruptive innovations, and much more.
   

  

**Your day-to-day**
* Advocate for engineering best practices and quality across larger teams and within PayPal, determining technical tasks for other engineers.
* Support the design, implementation, and operational excellence of software components, proactively improving existing structures and processes.
* Complete thorough assessments of implementation alternatives and their tradeoffs, providing recommendations for the technical engineering roadmap.
* Consistently focus on solutions while contributing to the vision of the domain.
* Exercise judgment in reconciling diverse and competing priorities to identify optimal solutions.
* Leverage strategic thinking and experience to anticipate consequences and risks linked to implementation choices, identifying patterns to reduce repetition into meaningful general solutions.
* Serve as a key voice on team-level processes (e.g., code and design reviews) and oversee projects, ensuring accurate, complete, timely, and operable solutions.
* Resolve technical inquiries and provide expert guidance to others.
* Provide technical leadership for a team with limited guidance from management or senior teammates.
* Interact and tailor communication with various technical and non-technical stakeholders, including product, support, and compliance teams.


**What You Need To Succeed**
* Expertise in developing and maintaining mobile applications at scale.
* Strong skills in Swift and Objective C, with knowledge of multi-threaded, asynchronous code.
* Proficiency with the iOS SDK and various frameworks like UIKit, CoreData, etc., and know-how to leverage them effectively to build robust iOS applications.
* In-depth knowledge of consuming GraphQL and REST APIs from mobile applications.
* Passion for mentoring and developing other software engineers.
* Ability to discuss and clarify complex topics with technical and non-technical audiences.
* Well-versed in testing best practices and familiarity with at least one testing framework for mobile development. Skilled at writing unit and automation tests.
* Expertise in the MVVM design pattern.
* Solid grasp of structured concurrency and Combine.


**We Believe in You**
 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply and / or let's chat!
   

  

 \_
   

  

 For the majority of employees, PayPal's balanced hybrid work model offers 3 days in the office for effective in-person collaboration and 2 days at your choice of either the PayPal office or your home workspace, ensuring that you equally have the benefits and conveniences of both locations.
   

  

**Our Benefits:**
 At PayPal, we’re committed to building an equitable and inclusive global economy. And we can’t do this without our most important asset—you. That’s why we offer benefits to help you thrive in every stage of life. We champion your financial, physical, and mental health by offering valuable benefits and resources to help you care for the whole you.
   

  

 We have great benefits including a flexible work environment, employee shares options, health and life insurance and more. To learn more about our benefits please visit https://www.paypalbenefits.com
   

  

**Who We Are:**
 To learn more about our culture and community visit https://about.pypl.com/who-we-are/default.aspx
   

  

**Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**
 PayPal provides equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. In addition, PayPal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities. If you are unable to submit an application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at paypalglobaltalentacquisition@paypal.com.
   

  

**Belonging at PayPal:**
 Our employees are central to advancing our mission, and we strive to create an environment where everyone can do their best work with a sense of purpose and belonging. Belonging at PayPal means creating a workplace with a sense of acceptance and security where all employees feel included and valued. We are proud to have a diverse workforce reflective of the merchants, consumers, and communities that we serve, and we continue to take tangible actions to cultivate inclusivity and belonging at PayPal.
   

  

 Any general requests for consideration of your skills, please Join our Talent Community.
   

  

 We know the confidence gap and imposter syndrome can get in the way of meeting spectacular candidates. Please don’t hesitate to apply.
   

  

 REQ ID R0112183

title: Security Engineer to Mainframe Security team | SEB, Stockholm
description:
Are you interested in working with SEB Mainframe environment that is facing major changes? Are you a driven sysprog with experience from working with mainframe? Do you want to work proactively with modernization and have a commitment in IT security? If so, this might be a great opportunity for You!
   

  

 We need to strengthen our Security team that works towards the mainframe platform. The team is part of SEB Technology and located in Solna in the Stockholm area. Mainframe is a vital platform within SEB where we work a lot with modernization and where many different initiatives are ongoing in the area of security.
   

  

**About The Role**
 As an engineer in the security team, you will be working with authentication and authorization including ICSF, encryption and key management for the platform. Another part in the job includes development and management of various code connected to this area of responsibility. Testing and developing solutions in connection with new products or other changes together with other teams is also part of the work.
   

  

 You will also be responsible, together with the team of six persons, for daily maintenance, support to other teams and system development for security related issues. Security is of highest importance for SEB as we are exploring and acting in a new landscape of banking such as Open Banking, API-ecosystem and AI.
   

  

 Your job is to be on the edge of security matters as well as being our evangelist of our security journey we need to embark.
   

  

 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

 You are a skilled technician/engineer/developer with experience of the Mainframe platform with an expertise on security.
   

  

 We presume you have worked with z/OS and TSO, and also is familiar with SMP/E installations. Knowledge and previous experience working with industry standards within the area (e.g., PCI-DSS, NIST, STIG) is eligible.
   

  

 Experience within ACF2 or RACF, zSecure and zMFA is advantageous.
   

  

 Development experience is beneficial and helpful in this job, preferable REXX and Assembler.
   

  

 You are a team player who appreciates and understands the importance of teamwork and working in an agile team. For this role, we also see that you have good knowledge of Swedish and English, both spoken and written.
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

 We offer many experiences and benefits to our employees, and there is nuance to every individual’s career experience, but the elements that define the core of our offering are:
   

  

* Friendly and welcoming culture.
* Innovative company at the forefront of technology.
* Agile and modern way of working.
* Extensive training and learning opportunities.
* We apply a hybrid model where we work both from the office and home.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 31 Aug 2024. If you have questions about the position, please contact Anneli Risberg, team manager for MI Infrastructure & Security on anneli.risberg @seb.se
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: ServiceNow Konsult
description:
Arbetsuppgifter
 




 Vi söker nu en ServiceNow Konsult till vår kund i Stockholm.
 



 Uppdraget innebär att du ska designa, utveckla och implementera flera moduler i kundens ServiceNow on-premise plattform samt delta i felsökning och incidenthantering. I rollen ingår även att stödja andra funktioner, såsom testledning och kravanalys, samt att lyssna på kundens behov och översätta dessa till utveckling av bästa lösningar och förvaltning av dem. Som systemutvecklare kommer du att vara delaktig i kodgranskning och kvalitetsarbete. Du kommer även att delta i olika projekt med din verksamhets- och ServiceNow-kompetens. Fokus ligger på att stötta arbetet med ITSM-applikationer, automationslösningar, utveckla och testa workflows och flows, vidareutveckling av serviceportalen samt att ha drivkraft att lära dig flera delar av ServiceNow-plattformen.
 



 Det är mycket meriterande om du kan verka som system- och/eller lösningsarkitekt. Erfarenhet av CMDB och Asset Management är också mycket meriterande.
 



  




 Kvalifikationer
 * ITIL Foundation 4
* Certifierad System Administrator - ServiceNow
* Minst 3 års erfarenhet av systemutveckling av ServiceNow i praktiken
* Scripting
* Certifierad Applikation Developer – ServiceNow
* Kompetens inom Javascript



**Börkrav:** 



* Erfarenhet av ServiceNow Platform Implementation
* God processkännedom gällande ITSM-processer och förmåga att bygga lösningar som stödjer dessa processer
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta i större offentlig verksamhet
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt och förmåga att förbättra arbetsprocesser samt föreslå effektiva metoder för att utföra arbetsuppgifter
* Kompetens inom verksamhetsprocesser och bekvämhet med att föreslå förbättringsförslag till beslutsfattare
* Mycket stor självständighet och social kapacitet
* Erfarenhet av att stödja olika roller, exempelvis kravanalytiker vid kundmöten
* Bekväm med att driva förbättringsarbete och förbättring av arbetsmetoder


 Personliga egenskaper
   


 För att lyckas i uppdraget som ServiceNow-konsult så ser vi gärna att du är självgående och har förmågan att arbeta effektivt både individuellt och i team. En analytisk och problemlösande approach är viktigt samt att felsöka och hantera incidenter på ett strukturerat sätt. Vidare är det viktigt att du är proaktiv och initiativrik, kan driva förbättringsarbete och föreslå effektiva metoder och lösningar för att optimera arbetsprocesser. 
 


 Företagspresentation
   


 Vår kund är en verksamhet i ständig rörelse där kvalificerade medarbetare är den viktigaste tillgången för att lyckas. Kunden ansvarar för bland annat hälso- och sjukvård, regional utveckling samt kollektivtrafik i den berörda regionen.
   




 När du blir en av oss
   


 Som konsult hos JobBusters kan du känna dig trygg med ett kollektivavtal i ryggen, tillgängliga konsultchefer och engagerade rekryterare. Du som konsult får även tillgång till vårt nätverk av spännande företag och uppdragsgivare! För oss är det viktigt att du som konsult trivs, känner en trygghet och gemenskap till oss som arbetsgivare. Vi erbjuder tjänstepension, löneväxling och möjlighet till flexpension. Du får även tillgång till vår förmånsportal, där du utöver friskvårdsbidrag har tillgång till mängder av rabatter och erbjudanden inom hälsa, hem och fritid, transport, sjukvård och mycket mer! Ditt välmående är av högsta prioritet för oss och vi erbjuder därför dig som anställd Företagshälsovård för att hantera vardagens alla utmaningar, både på jobbet och i privatlivet.
 


 Lön
   


 Enligt överenskommelse.
 


 Tillträde och ansökan
   


 Heltid, kontorstider. Vår kund önskar start 2024-09-16 och uppdraget förväntas löpa t.o.m. 2025-03-17 med möjlighet till förlängning. Du kommer att vara anställd av JobBusters som konsult hos vår spännande kund. Vi går igenom ansökningarna löpande och i konsultvärlden går processerna oftast snabbt. Rollen kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdatum, vänta därför inte med att skicka in din ansökan (gärna i Word-format). Sista ansökningsdag är 2024-08-30.

title: Senior iOS Developer (UniFi Protect)
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for a highly skilled Senior iOS Developer to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.
   

  

 Product and team**
 UniFi Protect. The App Brings The Full Functionality Of Our Web-based Camera Security Application To Your Mobile Device. Adopt And Manage Your Protect Devices, Stream Low-latency Livestreams, And Download Localized Recordings Directly To Your Phone. Designed For Residential And Commercial Use, UniFi Protect Also Allows You To
   

  

* Maintain complete data privacy with Cloudless recording storage.
* Quickly scrub through hours of Timelapse footage to pinpoint the exact moments you're looking for.
* Personalize security notifications based on a wide variety of individual, vehicular, and atmospheric-based detections.


**Responsibilities**
* Create state of the art mobile apps that are both powerful and easy to use with elite UX applied
* Work in an agile environment, individually and with a team of developers across multiple R&D sites globally


**Requirements**
* Proven track record of releasing and maintaining successful iOS apps
* Ability to write efficient code, with knowledge of performance implications, such as CPU and memory usage
* Extensive knowledge of Swift and SwiftUI
* Experience with WebRTC, BLE and Core Audio
* Experience with RESTful APIs
* Proficient understanding of Git versioning tool
* Passion for design and great UX, understanding Apple´s human interface guidelines
* Highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice to have**
* Experience of networking
* Experience with SwiftLint, SwiftFormat or similar tools


**Benefits**
* International work environment and work with global development teams
* Excellent work conditions
* Compensation package matching global standards. We offer great pay, perks, and benefits
* Wellness benefit
* Flexible work hours
* Lunch at the office 3 x per week
* Snacks and drinks in the office
