As part of that, we help to gather, process, and refine valuable data for use in decision-making.
   

  

 Our digital transformation solutions enhance efficiency, cash flow, and end-user experience. We serve a growing client list throughout Europe. See why organisations of all sizes choose XBP Europe as a digital transformation partner, visit our website at www.xbpeurope.com
   

  

**Job Description**
 Business Development Manager (Hybrid)
   

  

 Stockholm, Sweden
   

  

**Job Purpose**
* Deliver support to the Northern Europe Sales organization during the sales and bid process and act as the project (bid) owner in providing solution proposals, functional specifications and pricing estimates to meet customer requirements.


**Key Responsibilities**
* Provide alignment of proposal with Operations, Business Solution Group, IT and other departments involved e.g. HR, Finance.
* Analyze and reflect customer business requirements for both solutions and services we want to provide
* In conjunction with Sales team, provide professional presentations or demonstrations for clients addressing specific business cases
* Support operational/delivery excellence through precise requirements delivery for implementation of solutions/services
* Meet with assigned clients when needed and perform an initial assessment of a problematic or required situation to ensure comprehensive requirements are gathered for new opportunities good understanding of requirements and objective of customer.
* Engage with solution and deal teams to get business cases decribed and calculated
* Support new solution/service enablement by identifying potential business cases and defining matching services for the markets in scope
* Support business strategy to ensure customer and revenue growth.
* Ensure quality of bids and functional specifications
* Professional bid management (driving the completion of timely offer submission)
* Identify cross- and upselling opportunities together with Sales and Strategic Deal Teams
* Together with Business Strategy, identify and define new solutions and services creating new business opportunities
* The employee is required to undertake any task for which they have been trained, have suitable qualifications and or experience as deemed by a member of management.


**Key Requirements**
* A self-starter who can easily motivate themselves.
* Ability to lead and manage virtual teams to deliver quality outcomes within agreed timeframes.
* A committed, organised, confident, consistent and ambitious person.
* 5-10 years’ experience in customer management, presales and/or design of complex customer solutions
* Strong business acumen and technical aptitude in the markets and technologies XBP Europe is focusing on
* Business Development experience and aware of the future impacts of technology on business operations.
* Ability to quickly build trusting relationships with clients.
* Expert at uncovering client needs, developing compelling propositions and building comprehensive financials models and business cases.
* Excellent presentation and communication skills.
* Experience building hi-level customer relationships with both technical and business contacts.
* Evidence of flexibility and accuracy.
* A client centric and an entrepreneurial thinker.
* Good knowledge of Financial Services and operations, including use of its technology.
* Exposure to commercial situations and a solid background in transforming operations using a variety of tools and techniques.
* Recognised certs that evidence strong communications skills and numeracy.
* Excellent language skills in Swedish and English. Norwegian and/or Danish is beneficial.
* Willing to travel within the Nordics.


**Our Offer**
* Working in a dynamically developing international company at the XBP Europe with global standards and systems.
* Individual Development Plan and career growth
* Social package and employee benefits of the corporate level:
* Permanent Contract
* Referral Bonus
* Annual Bonus Plan
* Medical Benefits
* Holiday entitlement
* Pension scheme


**Disclaimer**
 XBP Europe prioritizes individual privacy and is devoted to safeguarding personal data. Our recruitment policy focuses on selecting the most qualified candidates based on merit and skills aligned with position requirements. Candidate information is handled in strict compliance with GDPR policies and relevant data protection laws. Read our GDPR policy here.
   

  

 XBP Europe is committed to creating a diverse environment. Qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their characteristics or preferences. We provide equality, fairness and respect for all in our employment, whether temporary, part-time or full-time. We oppose and avoid all forms of unlawful discrimination including those known as protected characteristics.
   

  

 XBP Europe recruiters or representatives will only contact you by emails ending with xbpeurope.com or exelatech.com. We would never ask you for payment or ask you to deposit a check into your personal bank account during the recruitment process.

title: Solution Sales Executive
description:
Join Schneider Electric and power your career!
   

  

 Discover the opportunity to join an international, dynamic, and responsible company that fosters the development of all its people around the world. Every day, we empower employees to achieve more and experience exciting careers. Find out how our values and unique position make Schneider Electric the employer of choice.
   

  

**Client Sales Executive**
 A Hunter role responsible for consultative selling to deliver value to existing & new Process Automation customers as the
 **digital partner for sustainability and efficiency** 
 across multiple segments with a special attention to the Green Energy Landscape within Nordic & Baltic.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* The Client Sales Executive is responsible for establishing and maintaining the sales relationship with each client/prospect in their portfolio at every level from C-Level to departmental line managers.
* Drives new business through the identification, development, negotiation, and closure of new services agreements with prospects and clients, and participates in the subsequent maintenance of client relationships.
* Targets potential leads, qualifies them, and leads the pursuit team in crafting and positioning the deal. To this end, they leverage their industry and financial business knowledge to create demand and persuade through the development and presentation of compelling purchasing rationales.
* Product, Services and Solution agreements will encompass all offerings and range in scale from short-term consulting engagements to complex, multi-service, multi-year and global partnerships. Specific new sales/revenue and profit margin targets are established annually by management.
* Shares industry, deal, and sales best-practice knowledge with the SE sales community and may mentor and coach other Sales Executives.


**Job Essential Functions**
 Sales Executives are responsible for managing the entire sales process from identifying prospects to negotiating contracts. Other job essential functions include, but are not limited to, the following:
   

  

* Create and maintain territory sales plan
* Identify prospects and create entry strategies for each
* Utilize business and financial knowledge to create value propositions
* Execute competitive sales tactics to win business
* Coordinate deal crafting and positioning
* Lead or participate in contract negotiations
* Manage demand and qualify opportunities


**Education**
 Undergraduate degree, preferably in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or Economics. - An MBA, graduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, Economics or Engineering or professional qualifications in Law or Finance are considered a plus.
   

  

**Experience**
* 3-5+ years of complex, solution selling sales experience in Schneider’s target Industries (e.g. Power and Utility, Oil and Gas, Process Manufacturing, Water & Waste Water, Renewable Energy, New Energy Landscape).
* Strong technical knowledge: DCS, Safety Systems, Advanced Applications, PLC, CONTROLS, M&I
* Ability to establish C- Level relationships
* Experience in business transformation solutions
* Track record of meeting/exceeding yearly quota
* Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and ERP/CRM related tools;
* Advanced time management and analytical skills. Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.


 Care. Connect. Challenge. Commit.
   

  

 Our values define our company. Who we are, our customer approach, how we do business, what it’s like to work here, and the kind of people we want to attract and retain. We care for our planet, our customers, our company, our team, and ourselves. We connect to customers and colleagues; we are open and respectful. We challenge others and embrace challenges ourselves. We commit to change by leading the change.
   

  

 At Schneider Electric, because we value our employees, we offer a competitive benefits package that includes medical, dental and vision, matching 401(k), training and development opportunities and much more. Join Schneider Electric and together, let’s make the most of your energy.
   

  

 Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 €34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Group Manager - Head of Finance Core
description:
***Are you ready to lead a dynamic team in reshaping the future of finance through innovative strategies and seamless processes?***
**About Us**
 At Scania, we are committed to change the world of finance for Scania’s Factory operation & Head office functions by leveraging cutting-edge technology and driving value creation through demand-driven initiatives with our new Industrial ERP Backbone.
   

  

 Our focus on standardization, digitalization and data utilization forms the foundation for making strategic and profitable business decisions in today's fast-paced environment. Our aim is to change our process & system landscape globally, i.e. in Europe, Latin America and China.
   

  

**Your Contribution**
 We are seeking a visionary and talented leader to drive our Finance Core project and in that context be the line group manager for Finance Core/ZETC, and as such spearhead the transformation of finance processes within our new ERP landscape.
   

  

 The ERP landscape is based on SAP S/4 Hana and your team will work tightly with other cross-functional streams such as Source-To-Pay and Order-To-Cash, Plan-To-Manufacture etc to fulfill Scania’s end-to-end process approach in a global context.
   

  

 As the Group Manager and Finance Project Lead, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to streamline end-to-end processes and uphold our global process approach at Scania.
   

  

 This also includes to structure the Finance Core project’s way of working in a way that delegation of scope/responsibilities can be achieved within in the whole project organization.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and mentor a high-performing team in the implementation of finance processes within the ERP program – where finance is a fundamental part of & closely connected to the Scania Industrial ERP Backbone program (IEB)
* Collaborate with business and IT project resources to ensure alignment with overall Finance Strategy
* Establish an inclusive work environment that fosters innovation and collaboration among finance experts
* Communicate effectively with senior management to provide project updates, insights, and risk assessments
* Drive strategic initiatives and contribute to the advancement of finance processes and systems
* Uphold People & Culture processes (salary reviews, performance reviews, etc.) for your line team


**Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related field
* Proven experience in leading finance projects or transformations
* Strong leadership skills with the ability to inspire and empower teams
* Proven experience as a manager in the line organisation
* Strategic mindset with a focus on driving business outcomes
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills


**Why Join Us**
* Opportunity to lead impactful projects that shape the future of finance
* Work in a dynamic and international environment with a focus on continuous improvement
* Engage with senior management and drive strategic decision-making
* Competitive compensation package and professional development opportunities


**Apply now**
 If you are a strategic thinker with a passion for leadership and transformation, apply now to be part of our innovative finance team at Finance Way & Innovation Office!
   

  

**Additional Information**
 For more information, please contact Anne-Marie Öhlén, anne-marie.ohlen@scania.com
   

  

**Application**
 We look forward to receiving your application, including your CV and cover letter no later than 2024-09-17.
   

  

 A background check might be conducted for this position.

title: Accounts Payable/Accounts Receivable Accountant (part time)
description:
**About us**
 In 2022, Instabee was founded after combining Instabox and Budbee - two leading last-mile delivery companies with three consumer-facing brands: Budbee, Instabox and Porterbuddy. Instabee serves millions of consumers across Europe with convenient deliveries and is on track to become the leading European e-commerce enabler. Always with the customer at heart.
 



 We’re fast, both in terms of parcel delivery and when it comes to growing our business. So far our journey has taken us from Sweden to the rest of Scandinavia and parts of continental Europe, but we have no plans to stop anytime soon. As we continue to expand our product offering to new merchants and geographic regions, our logistical network and operations are getting increasingly complex.
   





**About the role** 




 We are looking for a person to join our global Finance team as a part time AP/AR accountant. As an AP/AR accountant you will be a key member of the Accounting department supporting both the AP and the AR team with their daily invoice handling.
 



 Your tasks will include, but not be limited to:
 


* Verify and record vendor invoices for Swedish and non Swedish Instabee entities
* Book vendor payments
* Contact with vendors as well as other Instabee departments on vendor invoice related questions and payments
* Follow up on customer invoice related matters
* Contact with customers as well as other Instabee departments on customer invoice related questions


* Close collaboration within our accounting and controlling team



  





**About you** 




 We are looking for a proactive doer, with a can do mentality, who is not afraid to roll up their sleeves to get the job done. Preferably you study finance, accounting or business administration and want to learn and gain experience in the accounting field. If you have previous experience from similar role/s that is beneficial.
 



 You enjoy a humble but dynamic environment with various contact areas. Moreover, you are a diligent and independent person who values structure and teamwork.
   

  





 If this is you, we really can’t wait to meet you!
 



**What we offer**
 The chance to be part of something truly amazing and fun. We promise that you will be challenged, have the opportunity to develop your skill set, and work with amazing and smart colleagues. The journey ahead excites every Instabees working here today, and we are just getting started.
 



*This recruitment process consists of personality tests via Alva Labs and background checks as a review of previous public criminal records. The result is public information that is handled confidentially. This is mandatory for all recruitment processes in Sweden.*

title: Paid Media Manager
description:
**Job Description**
*We are now looking for a paid media manager to join our team. Does this sound interesting? Keep reading.*
 You will be joining a team of professionals whose responsibilities vary from web optimization, SEO/SEM, paid social media and display marketing, analytics & testing as well as exploration of new ways of working within the online sales area. We’re constantly trying to find new ways of doing things, and have a learning and development oriented mentality. The best idea always wins!
   

  

 In this role you will primarily design, execute, and manage paid media campaigns on various platforms like Google Ads, Meta (Facebook, Instagram), LinkedIn Ads, affiliate networks and others. You will also monitor and optimize campaign performance, adjusting bids and audiences as necessary to improve results.
   

  

 Other tasks include:
   

  

 Collaborating closely with creative teams to develop compelling ad content and visuals
   

  

 Conducting A/B testing to improve campaign results, continually refining our paid media strategies
   

  

 Producing detailed reports on campaign performance, providing insights and actionable recommendations for future initiatives
   

  

**Your Profile – Strong Analytical Skills**
 We see that you have hands-on experience with A/B testing and conversion rate optimization. It is important that you have strong analytical skill with the ability to translate complex data into actionable plans. You have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, as well as ability to adapt to changing priorities and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
   

  

 Creative problem-solving skills, able to find new ways of working and demonstrated ability to analyze data, identify trends, and make data-driven decisions is required.
   

  

 Exceptional communication, organizational, stakeholder and time management skills are also necessary for this role.
   

  

**Your background**
* Bachelor's degree in marketing, digital media, or a related field OR relevant corresponding experience
* 2-3 years of hands-on experience managing paid media campaigns, with a focus on Meta and Google Ads, display and affiliate
* Proficiency in Adobe Analytics (or Google Analytics), Google Ads, Facebook Ads Manager, and other related platforms


**Like to join us?**
 If you have any questions regarding this position, please contact Joel Grännby: jogr@danskebank.se
   

  

 We process applications on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.
   

  

 Last day to apply is 30th of August.
   

  

 We look forward to your application!
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Senior Consultant
description:
**About Northgrounds** 




 ​
 



**Our mission is to help our clients harness the power of AI to become the next generation of AI-driven businesses. We prioritize understanding their unique business needs, ensuring AI solutions are customized to address their specific challenges.** 




**At Northgrounds, we’re not just about technology; we’re about transforming businesses and creating real customer value through AI.** 




  
 



**Why Northgrounds?** 




  




* Big Brands: Work with renowned industry leaders and well-known brands, implementing advanced AI solutions such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud AI, and Microsoft Azure AI.
* Making a Real Difference: Your work will deliver tangible results, such as increasing operational efficiency, improving customer experience, and driving revenue growth for our clients. For example, using predictive analytics to forecast sales or deploying computer vision for automated quality control.
* Innovative Culture: Our culture is built on having fun and fostering a comfortable environment. We believe in your potential and autonomy.
* Growth Opportunities: Northgrounds is expanding rapidly. Joining us now means endless possibilities, including potential leadership roles.
* Share Ownership: We offer opportunities to earn shares in the company, investing in your future alongside ours.
* Dynamic Environment: Enjoy a work environment where creativity and innovation are encouraged, and your contributions make a significant impact.
* Continuous Education: We ensure you participate in educational programs and conferences like NeurIPS and CVPR, ensuring you stay up-to-date with the latest AI advancements.
* Cutting-Edge Technologies: Work with the latest AI tools and technologies, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Azure Machine Learning for building and deploying models at scale.



  
 



**The Role** 




  





 As a Senior Consultant at Northgrounds, you will:
 


* Work closely with clients to understand their business and identify how AI can drive value. For example, using machine learning to optimize supply chain logistics or employing natural language processing to improve customer service.
* Develop and implement AI strategies that align with client goals, such as deploying advanced analytics for business intelligence or using computer vision for automated inspections.
* Lead projects from conception through execution, ensuring successful delivery. This includes managing timelines, resources, and stakeholder expectations.
* Mentor junior consultants and contribute to the continuous improvement of our consulting practices.
* Collaborate with a diverse team of experts passionate about making a difference.



  
 



**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* Experience: Minimum of 2 years of hands-on experience in AI and business consulting, including successful implementation of AI projects from start to finish.
* Technical Expertise: Proficiency in AI technologies such as machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing. Familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and scikit-learn.
* Industry Knowledge: Understanding of how AI can be applied in various industries such as finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing to solve real-world business problems.
* Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, create compelling presentations, and write clear and concise reports.
* Project Management: Experience in managing AI projects, including scoping, planning, execution, and delivery, with a track record of meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.
* Leadership and Mentorship: Ability to lead and mentor junior consultants, fostering their professional growth and development.
* Continuous Learning: Passion for staying updated with the latest advancements in AI and continuously improving your skill set.



  
 



**Join Us** 




  





 If you’re ready to empower businesses with AI at Northgrounds and have fun doing it, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and become a part of a team that’s not just building technology but building the future of business.
 


-

title: Lead Architect for Lending and Leasing - Tietoevry Banking
description:
**About The Company**
 Tietoevry Banking delivers scalable and modular Software as a Service and other market leading software built by unmatched industry expertise, accelerating the digital transformation of banks and financial institutions. As a leader in the Nordics and beyond, their more than 3500 experts help 400+ customers to gain a competitive edge.
   

  

 Want to know more about Tietoevry Banking? Click here.
   

  

**About The Role**
 Tietoevry Banking is looking for a
 **Lead Architect for Lending and Leasing** 
 . In this role, you will play a crucial part in shaping the technology roadmap for Lending and Leasing software products. You will work closely together with customers and development teams to implement scalable and innovative architecture that is used by many Banks and Leasing companies throughout Europe. You will be deeply involved in all stages of the product lifecycle, from requirements and design to deployment and operations. Your responsibilities will include:
   

  

* Lead the development of end-to-end architecture covering Lending and Leasing origination, servicing, collateral management, asset management and pre-collection.
* Adopt new technologies and industry best practices to enhance product attractiveness and efficiency.
* Create and present product architecture to customers, partners, colleagues and other key stakeholders.
* Gather new requirements from business- and technical stakeholders and translate it into relevant architecture patterns, design and solutions.
* Conduct risk assessments and provide recommendations and guidance how to mitigate risks.
* Provide technical leadership and guide development teams how to implement target architecture.
* Stay updated with new Banking laws and regulations to secure product compliance.


**WHO ARE YOU?**
 The ideal candidate will have a strong background in software engineering with a focus on software architecture for commerical use. You should have the ability to drive the product agenda forward based on the overall strategy, product roadmaps and shifting customer needs.
   

  

**Specific Qualifications Include**
* Master’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Previous experience from R&D or software product developement, with a focus on solutions to be able to serve shifting market- and customer needs.
* Previous experience from working within Lending and/or Leasing business and software domains.
* Experience with development methods and concepts including SAFe, Scrum and DevOps on Microsoft platform.
* Strong understanding of several of the relevant technologies that are used within Lending and Leasing such as .NET, Azure, Rest API's, Kubernetes, JSON, SQL Server, Azure SQL and Mondo DB.
* Previous experience from Cloud development and/or adopting use cases with Generative AI is also a plus.


**But Most Importantly, We Believe That You Have**
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences.
* Strong analytical skills with the ability to assess business needs and recommend suitable architectural solutions.
* A robust business mindset and demonstrate a keen understanding of commercial dynamics, encompassing relationships, agreements and overall business acumen.


**What Tietoevery Will Offer You**
* Ability to lead and shape the next-generation of Lending and Leasing solutions in the Nordic market and beyond
* Interesting and dynamic work environment
* A team of great colleagues that constantly support each other
* Professional and personal development opportunities
* Competitive salary and benefits


**Other Information**
**Start:** 
 According to agreement
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, hybrid with 3 days per week in the office
   

  

**Employment:** 
 Fulltime
   

  

 This is a direct employment with Tietoevry Banking but the recruitment process is handled by A-hub on request of Tietoevry, all questions regarding the position should therefore be sent to julia@a-hub.se. Salary and employment conditions will be discussed seperately. As part of the recruitment process a background check will be done before any offer of employment.

title: Projektchef – komplexitet, kommunikation och kollektivtrafik
description:
Vill du vara med och förbättra och bidra till utvecklingen av kollektivtrafiken i Stockholm? Nu finns jobbet för dig!
   

  

****Om oss****
 Hos oss på trafikförvaltningen får du jobba med starka varumärken som SL, Waxholmsbolaget, Färdtjänst i Region Stockholm och Spårvägsmuseet.
   

  

 Tillsammans ansvarar vi för halva Sveriges kollektivtrafik och vi har höga ambitioner. Vi utvecklar en av världens mest hållbara och attraktiva kollektivtrafik. Och vi jobbar dagligen med att minska vår miljöpåverkan, öka social hållbarhet och ansvarfullt förvalta våra gemensamma medel. Utan oss stannar Stockholm.
   

  

****Om rollen****
 Avdelningen för Investeringsprojekt bygger ut och uppgraderar infrastrukturen för Stockholms kollektivtrafik så nästan 1 miljon människor kan resa med SL-trafiken varje dag. Vi driver ca 200 olika projekt, inom regionens 10-åriga investeringsplan på nästan 50 miljarder, i ett stort antal teknikområden i alla olika trafikslag.
   

  

 I rollen som Projektchef har du fullt personalansvar för medarbetarna i den egna gruppen samt för projektens organisation och bemanning. Du har även ansvar för projekten och programmens leveranser samt ekonomiskt planerings-, budget- och resultatansvar. Du leder arbetet och säkrar att mål och resultat uppnås. Du är också sponsorns, tillika sektionschefen, förlängda arm i att bland annat bereda underlag av styrningsbeslut och exekvera på dessa inom programmen/projekten samt säkra att tid, kostnad och innehåll uppnås och hålls.
   

  

**Vi söker nu en projektchef till:**
**Tunnelbana inom System** 
 – Som projektchef för gruppen System ansvarar du för att fortsätta driva arbetet framåt med att bygga upp gruppen samt för de leveranser och utvecklingen av de projekt som ingår. Projekten inom System omfattar:
   

  

* utbyte av manöversystem för röd och blå linje
* uppbyggnad av gemensam trafikledningscentral för tunnelbanan
* byte av radiosystem för hela kollektivtrafiksystemet
* ett projekt i tidig fas där man utreder en eventuell ny uppgång till Västra Skogen.


 Projekten befinner sig i allt från tidiga faser till genomförande och ställer stora krav på helhetssyn, god förståelse för olika tekniska discipliner samt god affärsmässighet och förståelse för livscykelaspekten av system. Inom system tunnelbanan finns ett stort behov av fortsatta investeringar.
   

  

 I gruppen, som ska växa, finns en handfull medarbetare och många konsulter. Rekrytering är en stor del av uppdraget då vi är inne i en konsultväxling för hela avdelningen.
   

  

****Vad vi söker efter:****
 För att trivas som projektchef är du relationsbyggande och tydlig i din kommunikation samtidigt som du är lyhörd. Du är van och utmanas av att hantera interna och externa intressenter såsom tex kommuner och internationella leverantörer. Du ger och tar feedback för att bidra till utveckling av medarbetare och dig själv.
   

  

**Vidare har du:**
* minst 5 års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet från beställarorganisation eller industri med ansvar att leda större projekt eller verksamheter i antingen projektledarroll eller chefsroll.
* minst 3 års dokumenterad arbetslivserfarenhet av att ha arbetat med komplexa systemprojekt (tvärfunktionellt arbete med många teknikgrenar, många gränssnitt, integration av system samt många intressenter) inom t ex signal, IT, kommunikation, ledningssystem, fordon, kollektivtrafiksystem.
* goda språkkunskaper muntligt och skriftligt i svenska och muntligt i engelska.


**Det är meriterande om du har:**
* högskoleexamen med relevant inriktning såsom tex (väg och vatten, samhällsbyggnad, maskinteknik, teknisk fysik)
* erfarenhet av att driva förhandlingar samt av offentlig upphandling
* erfarenhet av projektmetodiken XLPM (tidigare PROPS) eller motsvarande metodik.
* erfarenhet av offentlig verksamhet och politiskt styrda organisationer
* arbetat med utvecklingsarbete och förändringsprocesser inom en verksamhet


****Det här erbjuder vi dig****
 På trafikförvaltningen har du möjlighet att växa och utvecklas för ett helt yrkesliv. Här kan du vara expert och fokusera på ditt sakområde. Samtidigt som du jobbar i ett lag och i en organisation med stor bredd. Det finns stora möjligheter att röra sig mellan olika roller och uppgifter. Du har utrymme att forma din egen karriärväg och stärka både din personliga och professionella utveckling i en spännande och varierad miljö!
   

  

 Vi är en välkomnande och öppen arbetsplats där vi stöttar och hjälper varandra. Vi vet att nyckeln för att vi ska klara vårt uppdrag – är medarbetare som trivs, mår bra och kan utvecklas på jobbet. Därför lägger vi stor vikt vid att säkerställa hållbarhet i vårt arbetssätt, bland annat genom att erbjuda flexibilitet i vardagen och hybridarbete när möjlighet finns.
   

  

 Årligen erbjuds hälsoundersökning och friskvårdsbidrag på 5 000 kr. Hälsospåret, vår friskvårdssatsning, innehåller en rad olika hälsofrämjande aktiviteter. SL-kort är en annan uppskattad förmån hos oss. Läs mer om våra förmåner här .
   

  

****Välkommen med din ansökan!****
 Du ansöker med CV via vår hemsida, vi har inte möjlighet att ta emot ansökan via e-post. För att säkra objektiva bedömningar använder vi tester i samband med urval. Om du har några frågor om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande sektionschef Magdalena Protic, tfn 070-786 36 49. För frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Ulrika Falk, tfn 08-123 333 68.Sista ansökningsdag är
 **16 september** 
 . Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande säkerhetsprövningssamtal och registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan anställning. I vissa fall ställs krav på svenskt medborgarskap för säkerhetsklassade tjänster.
   

  

 Eventuella arbetsprov kan bli aktuella för tjänsten.
   

  

****Webb och sociala medier****
 För mer information om hur det är att jobba hos oss, besök vår karriärsida . Du hittar oss också på LinkedIn .
   

  

 Nyckelord: projektchef, projektledare, järnväg, tunnelbana, system

title: Security Manager, Nordics
description:
International SOS is the world’s leading medical and security services company with over 12,000 employees working in 1,000 locations in 90 countries. Established 35 years ago, we have become the market leader in global telehealth services and digital health solutions for an extensive client base of Fortune 500 companies, NGO’s and governments around the world.
   

  

**About The Role**
 The Security Manager will also act as the security peer to our clients in this location. They will be responsible for building on existing relationships and / or creating new ones within the client ecosystem to become a key advisor and strengthen relationships.
   

  

 The Security Manager will also support in demonstrating the value, real-life use, and the ongoing development of our Digital portfolio, as it pertains to a security user. They will help to embed our Digital solutions within our clients and act as a technical counterpart in helping enhance the value of these services with support from the region’s Digital Solutions Advisor (DSA).
   

  

****Key responsibilities****
* Be the security subject matter expert and partner for the commercial team in Nordics. To work closely with the Business Development Managers (BDMs)/ Directors to identify New Business opportunities, nurture them and drive acquisition of new logos and to work closely with the Key Account Managers (KAMs)/Directors to increase client stickiness and identify further opportunities for growth with that client (through consulting or other services)
* Support BDMs and KAMs to retain and strengthen our current partnership with clients, including actively participating in the development of the account plans to drive account growth
* Act as a subject matter expert on security for Workforce Resilience programs and consulting solutions; attend meetings with clients and prospects to scope solutions and drive positive client engagement from the outset
* Act as a subject matter expert on our Digital solutions helping our security audience to leverage value and help to drive utilisation in the region, in collaboration with our DSAs.
* Identify Security Consulting and Managed Services opportunities in collaboration with the regional Consulting Practice and Nordics Commercial team


**About You**
* Experience in security: corporate, consulting, military, police, intelligence, NGO, disaster management or relevant field of academia
* Crisis Management, Travel Risk Management, Intelligence, Security Risk Management
* Digital solutions experience
* Client management experience
* Business development related experience advantageous
* Extensive international experience
* Fluent in spoken and written in a Scandinavian language (e.g. Swedish / Danish / Finnish / Norwegian)


**Benefits**
* Competitive salary and incentive scheme
* Warm, supportive, and open company culture
* An opportunity to thrive in a global environment
* Hybrid working
* Birthday holiday and option to purchase additional annual leave
* Comprehensive Benefits Package


 #Europe #AG-1 AG1
   

  

 International SOS Facts & Figures 2022 (internationalsos-facts-figures.com)
   

  

 At International SOS, we offer a great working environment, thanks to our commitment to flexible working, diversity, and development. We encourage every person to be their personal best by creating an environment of inclusion, equality and support.
   

  

 International SOS has been recognised as a Top Employer in the UK by the Top Employer’s Institute (TEI) for 2024.

title: Controller Non Financial Reporting
description:
Are you passionate about driving positive change in sustainability and work closely with the Headquarter organization? Here at Lindt Nordic, we are looking for a dedicated individual to take ownership in an area of Non Financial Reporting Directive responsibilities which is fast developing.
   

  

 As NFR Controller at Lindt Nordic you are responsible coordinating and implementation a high standard of sustainability reporting and practice required locally but also globally from the Group NFR controller team.
   

  

 The role is newly created entry level position based in Stockholm and will include all our four markets in the Nordics: Sweden, Denmark, Norway and Finland. The role will be part of an international Finance Team of 10 team members.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities include:**
 Data Collection
   

  

* Coordinate the internal non-financial reporting closings for Budget, Latest Estimates and Actuals.
* Support Data Collectors and Data Validators in the collection & review of relevant data
* Safeguard data submission deadlines for local Subsidiary defined by Group Controlling (defined in Non-Financial Reporting instructions) and adhere to principles set out in the non-financial reporting manual.
* Participate in group audit process if required. In case local audit processes are foreseen, act as first point of contact.
* Follow up on recommendations brought up by the Group / local auditor.
* Participate in non-financial budget and YE-review meetings.


 Reporting Regulations
   

  

* Keep track of latest developments in Reporting standards and local (country) legislations and assess impact on reporting.
* Attend NFR trainings and train the local organization on the training content (“train the trainer”).
* If necessary, inform the Group NFR Champion / NFR Controller about potential group-wide impact.


 Reporting Manual
   

  

* Participate in review rounds of the Non-Financial Reporting Manual and give feedback to the group.
* Participate in yearly update call of changes in the Manual coordinated by the group.
* Train local data collectors & validators as per Group requirements.


 Legal and Compliance
   

  

* Work closely with CFO and HR on topics such as Data Privacy, Anti Bribery & Corruption and ensure accurate reporting is done towards Group Compliance.


 Lindt internal Control System (LICS)
   

  

* In cooperation with Group LICS team and the local dedicated LICS champion, define local application of group-defined standard controls.
* Perform defined LICS controls in line with description stored in BWise. Coordinate the LICS control performance and testing together with the local LICS champion.


**Required Experience And Skills**
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Under 1 to 2 years of work experience with a global FMCG in the any of the following field is a plus: Accounting/Controlling, Internal/External Audit, Non-Financial Reporting
* Critical thinking and analytical skills: ability to identify trends in data and reports and to ‘see the big picture’
* Highly effective collaborator with ability to work and partner cross-functionally and influence without direct authority
* Sense of ownership, entrepreneurial mindset, and independent working behaviour
* Strong commitment to and passion for advancing social and environmental impacts in global value chains
* Curious about sustainability risks, impacts, trends, and best-practices
* Office suite skills, especially Excel. Familiarity with SAP is a plus
* Fluent in verbal and written English


**Personal Characteristics:**
* Excellent attention to detail
* A high level of interpersonal skills and ability to engage, communicate and influence internal and external stakeholders
* Methodical and structured approach to tasks
* With coaching, able to set priorities and clear targets
* High flexibility and adaptability
* Able to grow with the level of responsibilities and with the size and structure of the business


 Lindt is built on true entrepreneurship. This allows the employees to enjoy a high degree of freedom in terms of decision making but at the same time sets high demands on accepting responsibility for the assigned position. It is also fully acknowledged within all parts of the organization that we shape our own future and that this requires an adequate work volume.
   

  

**Does it sound interesting?**
 We hope so! If you're ready to make a meaningful impact and drive sustainability at Lindt Nordic, we encourage you to apply and be a part of our dedicated team. Together, we can create a more sustainable future. You are welcome to submit your application no later than the 27th of September 2024. Interviews are being held ongoing, so please send your application as soon as possible.
   

  

 If you have any questions regarding the position or the recruitment process, you are most welcome to contact Katarina Edlund Holmberg, Head of HR, kedlundholmberg@lindt.com.

title: Enterprise Open Source Sales Director
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing our global enterprise sales organisation. We are hiring
 **regional sales directors** 
 in Europe, Middle East, Africa, Latin America, Central America and North America, each of whom will be responsible for several teams of five to ten enterprise sales representatives.
   

  

 We deliver better open source from the data center to cloud and edge. Our Linux distribution Ubuntu is now the leading platform for public cloud compute, and the favorite platform for software engineers, data scientists and AI developers. Our mission is to accelerate the adoption and quality of open source globally, and our goal is to ship the most software on the planet by cores. A tidal wave of open source innovation is the next phase of the entire enterprise software industry, and we aim to be the most compelling way to ride that wave.
   

  

 Our customers include Global 500 enterprises and startups. We are expanding our product range from the base operating system - Ubuntu - to full enterprise solutions in infrastructure and applications. We can deliver software defined storage, private cloud solutions, container runtime environments, as well as databases, message queues, identity, observability, analytics, machine learning and web publishing capabilities. Customers love the idea that they can get security compliance and support for everything open source from a single company. Our goal is to have more solutions on tap than any other vendor, and we have built unique capabilities to make that possible across every cloud, every class of compute and every category of application.
   

  

 Canonical provides licensed enterprise software products, commercial support, managed services, consulting and training services to customers who are deploying Ubuntu or open source applications on the cloud, in their data center, or to the connected device and IoT ecosystem. We are just over 1,000 colleagues in 70+ countries and over $250m in revenue, profitable, on a steady but relentless growth trajectory. We are almost entirely distributed, with leadership spread across many countries. We believe that talent is equally distributed across the globe, and we are excited to hire, develop, promote and ultimately trust a diverse group of exceptional leads to build the best, not biggest, enterprise software company.
   

  

 We hire carefully and deliberately; our selection process is long and requires substantial work from applicants. It will take successful applicants three to six months to secure an offer. This is not a place to apply if you are in a rush to find a position, it is a worthwhile place to apply if you are ambitious and long-term in your thinking about your career and the dynamics which move the world forward. If you see clearly the rise of open source, and you understand the drivers of enterprise procurement and technical decision making, then you will understand why Canonical has such a tremendous long term advantage. You will also understand, given the ferocity of competition and the challenges of competing in a market of giants, that we have to set a very high bar for hiring and performance. In order to be a world leading company we select for exceptional ability as well as character, and then provide an environment which promotes teamwork and celebrates diligence, collaboration and effectiveness. All of those are easy to say but hard to do - at Canonical we are willing to be uncomfortable in pursuit of that excellence.
   

  

 In building our sales team, we look for five things:
   

  

* Empathy for the customer - a real understanding of customer needs, industry-specific challenges, and a desire to help customers solve their business problems
* High intellect - the ability to learn quickly, understand very complex subjects, and communicate clearly to build trust and confidence
* Passion for technology - a fascination with the state of the art from brilliant people solving hard problems, and fierce competition for large prizes
* Teamwork - a willingness to help others, to collaborate well with people from different disciplines, and to balance personal and team ambitions
* Energy - the drive to motivate oneself and others to achieve the best result for the team and our customers


 Ubuntu is already very widely adopted which gives us a credible basis for conversations in the market. Nevertheless, it requires real work for sales professionals to build on that adoption to create trusted and profitable commercial relationships with the enterprises in their territory. Our product managers and marketing teams run campaigns to generate awareness, engagement and leads, but you will need to go beyond managing inbound interest to develop the potential of your territory. You will need judgement as to which industries and companies are ready to go deeper with open source and Canonical, and energy to develop relationships in advance of proven interest. We expect professional practice, territory and account planning, as well as clear, complete and continuous reporting on pipeline status and activity, using standard professional tools.
   

  

 The successful candidate will carry an annual team bookings quota within their territory. They should be able to travel regionally for client engagement, industry conferences, and internationally for company events twice a year. They will be expected to demonstrate professionalism and effectiveness in managing their team. They will need to coach, mentor and lead by example. Their sales representatives are expected to prospect accounts for new business, maintain and develop existing relationships, and work with colleagues and partners on account strategy. They must be comfortable selling enterprise software, open source, cloud, virtualization, container technologies and technical software solutions to senior levels of the enterprise.
   

  

**Location:** 
 We are expanding our sales organisation globally and have open roles in every region.
   

  

 What your day will look like
   

  

* Build and execute a territory plan to prioritize outreach and prospecting
* Allocate portions of territory and accounts to sales representatives on your team
* Identify and prioritise new logo accounts in your territory for account-based marketing and prospecting
* Ensure that sales representatives have high quality account plans for existing accounts and priority prospects
* Monitor new pipeline development by your team, through outreach, prospecting, local marketing, and industry events
* Support contract closure to meet and exceed quarterly and annual bookings targets
* Be mindful and proactive in achieving tactical and strategic objectives
* Work with customer success to identify growth opportunities
* Ensure your team maintain accurate pipeline data and forecasts within Salesforce
* Represent the company, its solutions and software


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Bachelor's level degree, preferably in engineering or computer science
* Leadership and management skill
* Experience of open source technology and solutions
* Detail oriented with effective planning, organisation and reporting skill
* Experience in enterprise software or technology sales planning and execution
* Track record of achievement in sales targets and new account wins
* Self-discipline and motivation to be successful in a distributed team
* Professional written and spoken English, as well as any language that may be appropriate for your target market
* Ability to travel for customer engagements, industry events and company events


**Additional Skills Of Interest**
* Specific vertical experience, in particular finance, telco, health, energy, public sector, tech
* Experience speaking at conferences or industry events


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance when shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven commission structure. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* On-target earnings between USD 300k and USD 450k
* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team meetings in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Program
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Canonical has been a fully distributed company since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Teknikspecialist inom fundament och grundläggning
description:
Q Professionals AB är ett företag nicschat mot techsektorn. Vi har kollektivavtal och är medlemmar i Almega TechSverige.
   

  

 Beskrivning
   

  

 Är du en erfaren ingenjör med ett brinnande intresse för geoteknik och fundament? Vill du vara en central del av Sveriges framtida elnät och bidra till att säkerställa stabila och hållbara kraftledningar? Då är det här tjänsten för dig! Vi söker nu för klients räkning en
 **teknikspecialist inom fundament och grundläggning** 
 för luftledningsstolpar.
   

  

 Här får du chansen att arbeta i en dynamisk och utvecklingsorienterad miljö där din expertis är avgörande för att lyckas med våra långsiktiga mål. Du erbjuds en stimulerande arbetsmiljö där du får möjlighet att leda och påverka utvecklingen av Sveriges elnät.
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och sträcker sig mellan
 **23 september 2024 och 4 oktober 2025** 
 , med möjlighet till förlängning. Du blir anställd av Q och arbetar på uppdrag hos vår klient.
   

  

 Arbetsuppgifter
   

  

 I denna roll agerar du expertstöd och är en nyckelspelare för att säkerställa framgångsrika projekt inom området. Du kommer att samarbeta nära projektledare och andra teknikspecialister och stödja projekt med teknisk kravställning, granskning och utveckling inom fundament och geoteknik.
   

  

 Du får möjligheten att arbeta med att utveckla och effektivisera grundläggningskonstruktioner för kraftledningar och stationer, samt vara samordnande och koordinerande i de frågeställningar som uppstår under projektens olika faser.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter inkluderar bland annat:**
* Utveckling och förvaltning av tekniska riktlinjer för luftledningsfundament, med fokus på dimensionering, entreprenadutförande och geotekniska aspekter.
* Ta fram och utveckla normalstolpsfundament för Svenska Kraftnät.
* Leda, samordna och tekniskt utvärdera utvecklingsprojekt för fundament.
* Granska fundamentsritningar och beräkningsrapporter.
* Stödja projekt och andra enheter med specialistkompetens inom fundament och grundläggning.


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

 För att kvalificera för denna roll ser vi att du har:
   

  

* Civil- eller högskoleingenjörsexamen (minst 180 hp) inom samhällsbyggnad, geoteknik, byggteknik, eller liknande.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av betongkonstruktioner och grundläggning.
* Erfarenhet av att ha genomfört minst 5 uppdrag inom fundamentdimensionering.
* Erfarenhet av att dimensionera minst ett pålfundament med injekterade borrpålar.


**Meriterande**
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av fundamentdimensionering för luftledningar, ställverk, vindkraftverk eller brokonstruktioner.
* Erfarenhet av arbete med pålfundament.


 Låter detta som din nästa utmaning? Skicka in din ansökan redan idag och bli en del av vår resa mot framtidens elnät!
   

  

 Villkor
   

  

 Uppdraget är på heltid och sträcker sig mellan 23 september 2024 och 4 oktober 2025, med möjlighet till förlängning. Du blir anställd av Q och arbetar på uppdrag hos vår klient. Välkommen med din ansökan!
   

  

 Q har kollektivavtal och är medlem i branschorganisationen Almega samt i Svenskt Näringsliv. Företaget erbjuder interims- och rekryteringslösningar inom branscherna IT, teknik, administration, ekonomi, industri samt lager/logistik med personallösningar inom olika befattningsnivåer.
   

  

 Anställningsform: särskild visstidsanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: heltid | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2024/350 | Publicerat: 2024-08-27 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-05

title: Senior Legal Counsel & Business Compliance
description:
*Founded in 2018, Kreditz is already the market leader in PSD2 credit scoring products. We use Open Banking technology to create revolutionary real-time credit scoring products beloved by banks, financial institutions, iGaming companies, and more. Kreditz products enable consumers and businesses to gain financial inclusion and opportunities where traditional credit scoring systems fall short, as well as helping to prevent fraud and money laundering. Our long-term vision, 'One world, One score,' translates into our everyday mission of ensuring financial inclusion and opportunities for everyone globally. Everyone deserves a fair assessment.*
*To fuel our growth to the next level, we recently added EUR 10 million in funding from world-renowned investors Creades & Ingka Investments.*
*Come join us on our impactful mission!*
**Position Overview**
 Due to Kreditz’s continuous growth and ambitious expansion plans, we are seeking to bolster our Legal Team with a highly skilled and experienced Senior Legal Counsel & Business Compliance. We are in a dynamic phase of transitioning from a startup to a scale-up, rapidly expanding our market presence across the Nordic countries and Europe. Our diverse client base ranges from some of Europe’s largest banks and iGaming companies to smaller innovative businesses.
   

  

 As a Senior Legal Counsel & Business Compliance at Kreditz, you will have the unique opportunity to leverage your legal expertise in a business-driven environment. This role is ideal for a legal professional with a strong background in a law firm or financial institution who is looking to get closer to the business and take the next step in their career. You will be deeply involved in shaping and implementing legal strategies, focusing on regulatory compliance, data privacy, and mitigating legal risks.
   

  

 Based in Sweden, Kreditz operates across Europe, so it is essential to have a multi-jurisdictional mindset. You will report to the Chief Legal Officer.
   

  

**What Kreditz Offers**
* A unique opportunity to join an exciting growth journey and contribute to shaping the future of financial services, where every team member plays a crucial role in our success.
* A vibrant and supportive team of passionate, talented colleagues to share both small and significant successes, as well as personal milestones.
* 24/7 access to a gym, sauna, and sports center at our office, along with an additional wellness allowance
* A competitive salary package including pension contribution.
* Hybrid remote work


**Key Responsibilities**
* Draft and review various legal documents to ensure alignment with legal and regulatory requirements, as well as company policies.
* Provide expert legal advice and support on matters related to privacy (GDPR), PSD2, and other relevant regulations.
* Monitor and analyze regulatory and legal developments, such as PSD3/PSR, FIDA, and DORA, and assist the business in adapting to new requirements.
* Drive change and continuous improvement within the internal framework and data protection areas, including the development and maintenance of governing documents and processes.


**Candidate Requirements**
* Master’s degree in law (LL.M.) with a minimum of 5 years of practical experience in a law firm or corporate setting.
* Proven experience in handling legal matters related to the financial sector, privacy/GDPR, and regulatory compliance.
* Strong project management skills and the ability to drive change within the organization.
* Fluency in both written and spoken Swedish and English is required. Proficiency in other European languages is a plus.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
* High integrity, professionalism, and a strong interest in challenging the status quo through innovative solutions.


**To Thrive In This Role, We Believe You Are**
* Pragmatic and solution-oriented in your approach.
* Humble with strong communication skills.
* Eager to learn about our business and industry, with a willingness to collaborate across teams.
* Capable of working independently, taking initiative, and driving improvements in compliance standards.


**Appointment Of Position**
 Starting date Q4 2024, or as agreed
   

  

**Scope**
 Full time (tillsvidareanställning)
   

  

**Salary**
 Fixed monthly salary
   

  

**Reporting**
 You will be reporting to the company’s Chief Legal Officer
   

  

**Workplace**
 Our office is in Danderyd, Stockholm
   

  

**Recruitment Process**
 We interview candidates on an ongoing basis (ongoing selection).
   

  

 Please include your university transcripts with your application.

title: Specialist inom kontinuitet- och krishantering
description:
Vill du vara med och säkerställa att ICA förblir en trygg, motståndskraftig och pålitlig samhällsaktör? Vi söker en engagerad specialist inom kontinuitets- och krishantering till Risk & Säkerhet inom Digital & Teknologi. En avdelning som leder arbetet med att utveckla och stärka riskhanteringsförmågan i våra digitala produkter och tjänster.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I denna roll kommer du att stödja vår verksamhet som levererar digitala lösningar och teknologier, i att stärka och bibehålla den operativa motståndskraften och krisberedskapen.
   

  

 Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att leda och stödja produkt- och tjänsteägare samt deras team i utvecklingen av kontinuitetsplaner. Detta inkluderar att leda och genomföra utbildningar, organisera övningar, samt ge löpande rådgivning för att säkerställa att kontinuitetsförmågan upprätthålls och utvecklas i enlighet med verksamhetens behov. Att utveckla starka arbetsrelationer med nyckelpersoner i organisationen är en framgångsfaktor.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har erfarenhet inom kontinuitetsplanering och krishantering, gärna med en universitets- eller högskoleexamen i bakgrunden eller motsvarande kvalifikationer. Du är pedagogisk och har förmågan att leda andra genom dessa processer. För att kunna ge effektiv rådgivning och stöd är det avgörande att du har erfarenhet och förståelse av IT och IT-verksamhet. Du har också erfarenhet av att arbeta tvärfunktionellt, är lösningsorienterad och arbetar strukturerat och metodiskt.
   

  

 Din goda kommunikationsförmåga är central, då du behöver kunna förmedla komplex information på ett tydligt och anpassat sätt till olika målgrupper
   

  

 Om du känner att detta är rätt utmaning för dig, ser vi fram emot att höra från dig!
   

  

**Vad händer nu?**
 Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag då vi gör löpande urval, sista ansökningsdag 2024-09-22. För frågor om rollen, vänligen kontakta rekryterande chef Stefano Goudarzi, 072-22 01 551 och för frågor om rekryteringsprocessen, kontakta rekryterare Josefine Claeson 076-10 57 868.
   

  

 ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Om roller kräver det så behöver du genomgå tester, bakgrundskontroller och drogtestning innan anställning.

title: Building Services Leader - Nordic and Baltic Zone
description:
Are you ready to take charge and drive success in Digital Energy within the Nordic Baltic Zone? We are searching for a passionate leader to inspire and guide our team, turning our vision into a shared mission. If you're excited about taking on this challenge and making a significant impact within Schneider Electric, we want to hear from you! Join us in shaping the future of energy management and automation.
   

  

**What we offer you:**
 As a key member of our Nordic management team, reporting to the VP Digital Energy Nordic Baltic Zone, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the strategic direction of the services business in the region. Your focus will be on driving performance, providing support to countries, and leading future business development.
   

  

* Develop and implement the regional services strategy, concentrating on performance and future business development in alignment with company goals.
* Oversee the P&L of the services organization in the Nordic Baltic zone, emphasizing country support and operational excellence
* Prioritize customer satisfaction and loyalty through exceptional service delivery, strong customer connections, and initiatives that enhance customer retention.
* Drive operational efficiency by streamlining processes and resources, supporting countries to deliver services efficiently while maintaining high quality.
* Lead the development of a high-performing team of service professionals, setting performance objectives and nurturing a culture of high performance.


**What we are looking for:**
* Bachelor's or Master's Degree in Business Administration, Engineering, or a relevant field.
* Experience in leadership within the services industry, focusing on aligning service strategies with company goals and driving operational excellence.
* Proven track record of effectively managing P&L, achieving financial goals, and fostering a culture of high performance within teams.
* Fluent in English; knowledge of any Nordic language is advantageous.


 We are seeking a candidate with strong business acumen, financial expertise, and strategic insight to drive performance, support countries, and shape future business development. If you possess outstanding interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills, along with analytical and problem-solving abilities, we'd like to hear from you.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 Please submit your application soonest. We will fulfill the position as soon as the suitable candidate has been found. Read more about our Digital Energy Business:
   

  

 https://www.se.com/ww/en/work/campaign/buildings-of-the-future/
   

  

**Why us?**
 At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a
 **meaningful** 
 purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.
   

  

 We believe in
 **e** 
**mpowering** 
 our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.
   

  

 We embrace
 **inclusion** 
 as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.
   

  

 If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.
   

  

 Discover your
 **M** 
**eaningful, Inclusive** 
 and
 **Empowered** 
 career at Schneider Electric.
   

  

 €34.2bn global revenue
   

  

 +12% organic growth
   

  

 135 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 #1 on the Global 100 World’s most sustainable corporations
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

*Schneider Electric aspires* 
*to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best.*
*We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate and we ‘embrace different’ as one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.*
*You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion* 
*here* 
*and our DEI Policy* 
*here*
*Schneider Electric is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion,* 
*color* 
*, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct.*

title: Human Resources Manager
description:
**Job Description** 




 The interest for flight simulation is soaring and so are we! Navigraph is currently looking for an HR Manager for the office in Gamla Stan, Stockholm. This is a great moment for you to join a healthy company with considerable (but reasonable!) growth and take ownership of the culture, the HR processes, and help guide Navigraph into the future.
 



  





**About Navigraph** 




 Navigraph is a SaaS (Software-as-a-Service) company serving the international flight simulator community with charts, navigation data, flight planning services, and training material. Thousands of subscribers worldwide use Navigraph services in desktop and console flight simulators such as Microsoft Flight Simulator, X-Plane, and Prepar3D. Navigraph users fly for entertainment, curiosity, and possibly with the dream of one day becoming a pilot. Many active pilots also use Navigraph services because of their love for aviation.
 



  





 Navigraph was founded in 2003 and is headquartered in Stockholm. The team consists of 35 individuals with varying backgrounds in software development, aviation, marketing, and content creation. About two-thirds live near the Stockholm office, whereas the rest are based in countries such as the US, Canada, Austria, Australia, New Zealand, Ukraine, and the Czech Republic. The office language is English. Because of the rapid technical development of flight simulators and growing interest in aviation Navigraph has experienced a formidable growth over the past few years. Navigraph is still run and managed by its founders Magnus Axholt (CEO) and Stephen O’Connell (CTO). A vibrant user community, a solid product road map, a great product market fit, a thriving business, active and passionate founders, friendly and knowledgable colleagues, and an exceptional company culture make Navigraph a great place to work.
 



  





**Tasks and Responsibilities** 




 Navigraph is currently growing with around five new colleagues per year. With an exceptionally low staff turnover, the team is expected to be around 50 individuals in three years. During this time Navigraph will have moved offices and also restructured the organization from fairly centralized management to several teams with delegated team leads. It is essential to maintain the company culture that the teams subscribe to and feel comfortable working in, but procedures need to be revised in order to keep up with the growing organization.
 



  





 We work with recruitment consultants to attract candidates, TeamTailor to publish job posts and manage candidates, Ernst & Young and Fortnox for payroll management, Nordea for pension and benefits, and have several processes in place for HR and staff administration. However, we are ready to take the next step!
 



  





 As HR Manager at Navigraph, we want you to work directly with Stephen and Magnus and help shape the new Navigraph, which will still feel very safe and familiar to current colleagues, continue to attract and inspire new colleagues, and effectively support organizational growth.
 



  





 As an HR Manager at Navigraph you will be involved in the following areas: 
 



  




* **Recruitment & Staffing:** 
 Manage hiring processes, including requirement specification with management and team leads; author and publish job ads; manage applicants, schedule interviews, and communicate with recruitment consultants.
* **On- and Offboarding:** 
 With office management and team leads, manage procedures for on- and offboarding.
* **Employee Relations:** 
 Through direct request or via whistleblower function, address workspace issues, mediate conflicts, and proactively work for a positive work environment.
* **Staff Records:** 
 Maintain employee database (ICE, preferences, clearances)
* **Compliance:** 
 Ensure Navigrah adheres to labor laws and workplace safety regulations and has up-to-date employment agreements.
* **Policies and Procedures:** 
 Create and maintain HR policies and procedures, both internal to the HR team and through the Employee Handbook.
* **Compensation and Benefits:** 
 Oversee payroll, salary reviews, and benefits administration, including pension, insurance, gym memberships, reading glasses, and more.
* **Sick-Leave Administration:** 
 Manage administration relating to long-term sick-leave.
* **Performance Management:** 
 In collaboration with team leads, develop and oversee performance evaluation systems.
* **Training and Development:** 
 In collaboration with team leads, coordinate employee training programs and career development plans.
* **Talent Attraction Strategies and Employer Branding:** 
 In collaboration with the marketing team, ensure Navigraph’s brand and values are effectively communicated through job postings, social media, and the career website.
* **Company Values:** 
 In collaboration with management and office management, develop and document policies for instilling company values, including staff activities, workshops on good leadership, and the significance of inclusion and diversity.



  





**Required Qualifications** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Psychology, Business Administration, or related field
* At least three years of progressive experience in HR roles, including most of the tasks mentioned above.
* Fluent in spoken and written English



  





**Desired Qualifications** 




  




* Prior experience in leadership or management roles.



  





**Personal Qualities** 




  




* Strong interpersonal skills
* High level of personal integrity
* High standards for morals and ethics
* Ability to handle sensitive situations with confidentiality and tact



  





**Benefits** 




  




* **Workplace Insurance:** 
 As a responsible employer, we ensure you are fully protected at work and during your commute.
* **Pension:** 
 Together with Nordea we help you invest your pension to prepare for a nice retirement.
* **Remote Work:** 
 You are free to work at the office or from home, as you like.
* **Home Office:** 
 We provide you with an ergonomic workplace at home.
* **Health Insurance:** 
 Quick help, typically the next day, to avoid long waits at the doctor’s.
* **Paid Vacation:** 
 You will receive 30 days of paid vacation in advance. This is great if you are joining us right before the holidays.
* **Gym Card:** 
 5,000 SEK/year in health benefits to sponsor your gym or sports club membership.
* Parental Leave Top-Up: To compensate for a lower salary while on parental leave.
* **Complimentary Refreshments:** 
 All the cold drinks and warm beverages you need to say productive and inspired.
* **Free Training:** 
 We help you become an expert in your professional area.
* **Activities, Trips & Parties:** 
 We go on one or two conference trips yearly, host a Christmas party, and regularly arrange team activities.



  





**Application** 




 Please submit your application via the Navigraph Career website at careers.navigraph.com. The position is available immediately, and we are continuously reviewing applications and setting up interviews.

title: Programmatic Manager
description:
*Publicis Groupe is one of the largest communications groups in the world. We are building the agency model of the future and take a holistic approach to our clients’ challenges. By fusing together our media, creative, data and technology expertise, we are able to provide clients with integrated solutions, transformative ideas and compelling consumer experiences. We call it the Power of One.* 




*We are proud winner of many awards and nominations, both in Sweden and internationally. But nothing makes us prouder than to work with clients and brands such as Disney, Elgiganten, Mondelez, Volvo, VISA, Lantmännen, Nomad Foods, Lactalis, Midsona, Renault and many more.* 




  





*At Publicis, we put our people first. We are proud to be certified by Great Place to Work (2022, 2023, 2024), and have been recognized with a Magnet Award for our engaging culture (2023). Our goal is to become the leading workplace in our industry. We are based in a fantastic office in Odenplan, but also offer a flexible work policy.* 




  





**Job Description** 




  





 The Programmatic Manager will support the Head of Programmatic and oversee all aspects of programmatic campaign implementation. Key responsibilities include account management with stakeholders such as planners and clients, identifying new opportunities, and communicating effectively. Our programmatic team is currently based in both Stockholm and Malmö and we are excited to offer the flexibility for the right candidate to be based in either of these cities.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  





**Campaign Management** 



* Support Head of Programmatic in delivering exceptional work.
* Manage day-to-day operations and campaign delivery.
* Ensure operational excellence and proactive team communication.
* Showcase and analyze campaign performance across leading DSPs.



  





**Client Relations** 



* Build strong, trusted relationships with key clients.
* Provide exemplary client service and proactive management.
* Innovate programmatic media plans and roadmaps.
* Conduct monthly client meetings.



  





**Commercial Management** 



* Understand revenue models and identify growth opportunities.
* Ensure financial accuracy and PO management.



  





**Team Leadership** 



* Mentor team members.
* Share best practices and set clear progression plans.
* Foster a positive team culture and build strong internal relationships.



  





**Agency Engagement** 



* Participate in agency initiatives and industry events.
* Showcase team achievements and build relationships across Publicis Media practices.



  





**Qualifications:** 




  





 We seek an ambitious, proactive, and organized programmatic practitioner with the following specialist competencies:
 



  




* **Hands-on DSP Experience:** 
 Proficient in multiple DSPs such as Amazon DSP, DV360, Adform etc.
* **Analytical Skills:** 
 Strong ability to analyze and optimize campaign performance.
* **Client Management:** 
 Skilled in building and maintaining strong client relationships.
* **Revenue Management:**
