title: Entry-level communications specialist
description:
Be the voice of Canonical on social media
   

  

 We're on the lookout for an energetic and creative colleague to join our communications team. The ideal person for this role does not necessarily have experience in the field but is driven to learn, improve and come up with campaign concepts that make our brand stand out on social media. In this entry-level role, you will have the opportunity to build a career with a community-focused brand that touches every aspect of the modern technology stack.
   

  

 Our social media provides a window between the people who make our products and those who use them. With audiences in the millions, our online communities have the opportunity to talk to us, engage with us, provide feedback and be involved in the world of Ubuntu. From #opensource to coffee on K8s, launch previews to twitter storms over some cool release swag, our marketing team is committed to creating conversations with audiences all over planet earth: developers, tech enthusiasts, security engineers...
   

  

 The ideal candidate is passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. They would love to gain experience owning campaigns and collaborate with others to make them happen. They enjoy learning and improving themselves, the team and the organisation. They problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier. To succeed in this role, the candidate must be driven, organised and attentive to detail.
   

  

 This role sits in the communications team reporting to the director of communications.
   

  

**Location:** 
*This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.*
 What your day will look like
   

  

* Develop, schedule and publish content across multiple social media platforms
* Share regular updates and reporting on social media metrics, content performance and campaigns results
* Support the growth and nurturing of Canonical's social media audiences, while increasing engagement rates and valuable actions
* Develop flair with copywriting and asset creation to create messaging that aligns with the brand and its personality, and drives audiences towards action
* Be responsible for executing A/B and multivariate growth tests
* Be audience centric, focusing on platform and community moderation, as well as direct audience engagement
* Create awareness on integrated campaigns, product launches, webinar series, industry announcements and core content.
* Package all of Canonical's product offerings and educational material creatively, from bare metal, AI, Kubernetes to chats on diversity and CSR.


 What we are looking for in you
   

  

* Understanding of social media and communications best practices
* Hands-on knowledge of social media management tools like Sprout Social, an understanding of web analytics tools (social and web like Google Analytics) is a plus
* Proficiency with at least four social media platforms including LinkedIn, YouTube, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram and Reddit
* An analytical eye and a good sense for the type of content that performs best depending on platform and objective
* Understanding of educational content funnels, and using video as a core social media marketing asset
* Exceptional interpersonal skills and aptitude for forging trusting relationships across diverse, cross-functional teams
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong content marketer
* Proven ability to prioritise and differentiate what matters from the noise, meeting deadlines without sacrificing quality
* Affinity for planning is a must, experience with project management tools like Jira is an advantage
* Willingness to travel up to 4 times a year for internal events


**What we offer you**
 Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.
   

  

 In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, please ask your Talent Partner.
   

  

 🏠Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!
   

  

 📚Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum
   

  

 💰Annual compensation review
   

  

 🏆Recognition rewards
   

  

 🏝 Annual holiday leave
   

  

 👶Parental Leave
   

  

 🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme
   

  

 🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
   

  

 ✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
   

  

**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Head of Support and Delivery, Collection - Tietoevry Banking (m/f/d)
description:
**You may apply to Tietoevry by selecting Apply and fill your application details to the form. You may also Apply by using LinkedIn and populate details to your application from your LinkedIn profile.**
 Are you a person who likes to work with the latest technology while having experience in leadership and wants to join one of the largest tech companies in the Nordics? Then this is the role for you!
   

  

 We are looking for a Head of Support and Delivery who wants to be part of the Collection unit within Tietoevry Banking. Our Collection unit delivers market leading Debt Collection software both as on-premises as well as SaaS built by unmatched industry expertise.
   

  

**When joining Tietoevry Banking as Head of Support and Delivery**
* You will manage a group of talented and experienced individuals working with support, consulting, and customer specific development.
* You are responsible for establishing and implementing efficient processes within the unit that secures quality in our deliveries to the customers.
* You are responsible for establishing processes that secures smooth collaboration with other parts of the Collection unit.
* You are responsible for managing the business according to the guidelines and strategies while achieving the main goal of the business.
* You are responsible for securing fulfillment of SLAs and high billability on consultants and the delivery teams.
* You are utmost responsible for driving through changes, improvements and measures required to develop the unit.
* You are expected to, through your leadership, create conditions for a strong operating culture with positive attitudes, values, goals, and behaviors.
* You are expected to, through your leadership, maintain and provide the best conditions for the business to continue being an attractive workplace and to continue reaching common business goals.


 The position does not involve extensive travel, but some travel activities are expected.
   

  

**Who We Are Looking For**
* You have extensive experience (10+ years) of having full leadership in management positions such as project manager, unit manager or similar.
* You have experience in leading other leaders.
* You have extensive experience from delivering Software in various delivery models such as SaaS.
* You have experience from support, consulting, and development organizations.
* You have experience in working in a multicultural environment with customers and direct reports in various countries.
* You have a degree in Civil Engineering, Civil Economics, or other relevant degrees.
* You have good communicative properties, fluent language skills in Swedish and English.


**We also believe you have**
* Experience of working in leading positions within Tech and the Software delivery industry.
* Been part of a management team.
* Experience from Debt Collection industry is a great advantage.
* Good understanding of Tech and the consulting industry.


**We offer**
 We offer you professional growth, meaningful projects, open culture, and an outstanding work-life balance! We offer you an opportunity to create the future of a growing and fast-developing and important sector. We believe that our organizational culture is an important part of enabling you to be successful. We provide a flexible hybrid work model as part of our culture and way of working. Finally, we also believe in curiosity and learning as a lifestyle where you need to unlearn and relearn every day as new possibilities emerge.
   

  

**Did we get you inspired?**
 We look forward to your application!
   

  

 Please attach your CV or LinkedIn-profile and we will reach out to you. Interviews will be held on a continuous basis, so we encourage you to apply today. If you have any questions regarding this role, please contact the hiring manager Ali Tarihi, ali.tarihi@tietoevry.com.
   

  

 Hope to hear from you soon!
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Skövde
   

  

 We perform background checks on all final candidates.
   

  

**About Tietoevry**
 Tietoevry creates purposeful technology that reinvents the world for good. We are a leading technology company with a strong Nordic heritage and global capabilities. Based on our core values of openness, trust, and diversity, we work with our customers to develop digital futures where businesses, societies, and humanity thrive
   

  

 At Tietoevry, we believe in the power of diversity, equity, and inclusion. We encourage applicants of all backgrounds, genders (m/f/d), and walks of life to join our team, as we believe that this fosters an inspiring workplace and fuels innovation. Our commitment to openness, trust, and diversity is at the heart of our mission to create digital futures that benefit businesses, societies, and humanity. Diversity, equity and inclusion (tietoevry.com)

title: Fullstackutvecklare
description:
I rollen som Fullstackutvecklare hos vår kund kommer du att arbeta med att utveckla och underhålla moderna applikationer med fokus på .NET och C# i backend, där du bygger skalbara lösningar med SQL-databaser och REST API. Du kommer också att använda Azure-komponenter för att hantera och optimera molnarkitekturen. På frontend arbetar du med React Native för både Android och iOS, samt Next.js för webbapplikationer. Allt hostas i Azure, vilket innebär att du får möjligheten att arbeta med hela stacken i en molnbaserad miljö.
   





 En vanlig arbetsdag börjar med ett morgonmöte enligt Scrum där teamet stämmer av och går igenom eventuella problem. Därefter fokuserar du på utveckling, med mötesfri tid för kodning och problemlösning. Som tekniskt ansvarig för ett system håller du plattformen uppdaterad och hjälper systemägaren med prioriteringar. Du deltar även i projektmöten och har direktkontakt med kravställare för att förstå behoven.
 



**För den här rollen ser vi att du har erfarenhet av:** 



* Att arbeta som Fullstackutvecklare, med fokus på både frontend- och backend-teknologier
* .NET som ramverk och har arbetat med C#
* React Native och Next.js
* Molntjänster, såsom Azure (cloud hosting)
* REST API:er
* Erfarenhet av SQL, NoSQL och Dataverse är meriterande
* Goda kunskaper om IoT-lösningar är meriterande
* Du kan kommunicera obehindrat på både svenska och engelska



**Som person** 
 ser vi att du är engagerad och drivs av att arbeta nära andra, där du gärna delar med dig av dina idéer och erfarenheter. Du trivs med att vara delaktig och påverka både lösningar och arbetssätt, samtidigt som du är självgående och trygg i din seniora roll inom utveckling. Här får du utrymme att ta egna initiativ och verkligen sätta din prägel på projekten!
 



**Start** 
 : Omgående start med hänsyn till uppsägningstid. Uppdraget är på heltid och är tillsvidare
   





**Placeringsort:** 
 Stockholm, Norrort
 



**Ansökan:** 
 Intervjuer sker löpande och tillsättning sker vid rätt match
   

  





**Vad vi står för:**
 Vi på Camai erbjuder ett av marknadens branschledande anställningsvillkor med stor frihet som ledord. Vi drivs av att hitta det bästa uppdraget för våra medarbetare. Det roligaste som finns är att hitta en perfekt matchning mellan konsult och kund. Vi vet att alla har ett drömarbete, och vi är ett tight entreprenörsdrivet team som arbetar för att se till att du tycker att det är roligt att gå till jobbet, varje dag. Vi tror att kompetenta människor dras till varandra och vill jobba med likasinnade i spännande kunduppdrag.
 



 Vi har en av marknadens mest förmånliga ersättningsmodell anpassad för en modern konsultorganisation med mycket frihet. Vi har helt enkelt kul tillsammans!
   





**Varför ska du välja oss?**
 Med många års erfarenhet i konsultbranschen har vi valt våra tre värdeord med omsorg; kommunikation, ambition och balans. För att lyckas tror vi att våra medarbetare får vara med och forma sitt arbete efter prioriteringar och intresse i livet. Med din ambition och rätt verktyg från oss ser vi till att du utvecklas och samtidigt belönas på vägen.
   





*Vill du vara en del av vår fortsatta tillväxt?*

title: Regional Systems Operations Manager
description:
**Join Schneider Electric as our Regional Systems Operations Manager!**
 Are you ready to take the lead in driving our Digital Buildings Systems to unparalleled success in Europe & France? As the Regional Systems Operations Manager, you'll play a pivotal role in elevating our systems organization for Data Centre projects, providing expert support from sales to flawless project execution. Join us in shaping the future of energy management and sustainability!
   

  

**What we offer you:**
* Competitive Rewards: Enjoy a competitive salary, bonus scheme, and a range of enticing benefits including 28 days annual leave, pension scheme, and employee share ownership programme.
* Health & Wellbeing: Access various health and wellbeing support options, gym flex, and a holiday buy & sell programme to suit your lifestyle.
* Career Development: Benefit from our Open Talent Market, offering internal mobility opportunities, access to mentors, and projects globally, along with our comprehensive learning portal.
* Inclusive Environment: Experience our commitment to diversity and inclusion, with opportunities for all and support for those considering themselves living with a disability.
* Perks and Discounts: Enjoy shopping and dining discounts as part of our employee perks package.


**What your mission will look like?**
* Champion the transformation of our Digital Buildings Systems to best in class, from selling to successful execution of systems organization for Data Centre projects in Europe & France.
* Provide invaluable support to our teams and clients, ensuring excellence in environment monitoring systems and driving high performance systems culture.


**Key responsibilities will include:**
* Driving bid assessment, customer project performance, and aligned execution approach across the region.
* Acting as a trusted advisor, ensuring consistent customer experience and knowledge transfer across all projects.
* Ensuring the development, implementation, and maintenance of global rules, methodologies, processes, and tools.


**What will help you succeed?**
* Excellent communication and leadership skills to drive high performance and collaboration
* Analytical skills to handle complex matters effectively and experience in builduing management systems
* Professional knowledge of the electrical industry and experience in the Lifescience segment are valued
* Experience in a multicultural team environment and readiness to travel


 Ready to make an impact with us?
   

  

 Join Schneider Electric and be part of a team shaping the future of energy management. Apply now and let us learn about you!
   

  

**Why us?**
 Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive.
   

  

 €34bn global revenue
   

  

 128 000+ employees in 100+ countries
   

  

 45% of revenue from IoT
   

  

 5% of revenue devoted for R&D
   

  

 You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled
   

  

 It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.
