 🏝 Annual holiday leave
   

  

 👶Parental Leave
   

  

 🧑‍💼Employee Assistance Programme
   

  

 🧳Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'
   

  

 ✈️Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events
   

  

**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.
   

  

 Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.
   

  

**Canonical is an equal opportunity employer**
 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
As a Site Reliability Engineer at Embark you will be a game maker, enabling the teams in creating new ways to enhance experiences in interactive entertainment.
   

  

 At Embark, we believe that a great work environment includes diverse, welcoming and supporting teams as well as frictionless infrastructure and platform, allowing our developers to focus on delivering value and experiment.
   

  

 As an SRE, your knowledge and passion about automation, infrastructure and observability makes you a vital link between what we want to achieve and how it’s actually done. We strongly believe in automation and pragmatic technology choices to be able to iterate as quickly as possible.
   

  

 We are currently looking for an SRE for the team supporting THE FINALS and Arc Raiders (focused in Go). You can read more about our projects here.
   

  

 The team works as the backbone of the backend teams, building a solid platform while taking care of its cloud infrastructure, observability, alerting and CI/CD. Your role implies interfacing with other teams of the same nature in the studio, helping create a single avenue of innovations to benefit everyone. The team is cross functional, having knowledge in areas such as API design, cloud infrastructure, monitoring, automation and more.
   

  

**We Expect You To Have Experience In**
* Observability - you have used and created dashboards and configured metrics, logs and traces in tools like Grafana
* Cloud Infrastructure as Code - you have streamlined and/or automated the creation of cloud infrastructure for any of the major providers (GCP, AWS or Azure) using tools like Terraform
* Kubernetes - you have deployed workloads, installed add-ons and configured managed k8s clusters


**We would love if you have these**
* Experience with CI/CD and build tools like Bazel and Buildkite
* A passion for interactive experiences, games and new technologies
* Fluency in English
* The ability to be a great team player with great communication skills


 At Embark we offer competitive salaries, passionate colleagues to share knowledge with and much more, but most of all we invite you to take part of a journey into the unknown, to build creative, surprising and beautiful experiences together.
   

  

 Did we leave anyone out? Well, we welcome you, too! We think that the gaming industry is made better when everyone has a seat at the table.
   

  

 Be yourself at Embark and make games while doing so. Please apply with confidence. We can’t wait to hear from you (in English)!
   

  

*If this role doesn't quite match what you're looking for, feel free to apply to us via our "* 
*Open Application.* 
*"*

title: Consulting Manager
description:
**Our mission is to help our clients harness the power of AI to become the next generation of AI-driven businesses. We prioritize understanding their unique business needs, ensuring AI solutions are customized to address their specific challenges.** 




**At Northgrounds, we’re not just about technology; we’re about transforming businesses and creating real customer value through AI.** 




  





**Why Northgrounds?** 




  




* Big Brands: Collaborate with renowned industry leaders and well-known brands, implementing advanced AI solutions such as Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google Cloud AI, and Microsoft Azure AI.
* Making a Real Difference: Your work will deliver tangible results, such as increasing operational efficiency, improving customer experience, and driving revenue growth for our clients. For example, using predictive analytics to forecast sales or deploying computer vision for automated quality control.
* Innovative Culture: Our culture is built on having fun and fostering a comfortable environment. We believe in your potential and autonomy.
* Growth Opportunities: Northgrounds is expanding rapidly. Joining us now means endless possibilities, including potential leadership roles.
* Share Ownership: We offer opportunities to earn shares in the company, investing in your future alongside ours.
* Dynamic Environment: Enjoy a work environment where creativity and innovation are encouraged, and your contributions make a significant impact.
* Continuous Education: We ensure you participate in educational programs and conferences like NeurIPS and CVPR, ensuring you stay up-to-date with the latest AI advancements.
* Cutting-Edge Technologies: Work with the latest AI tools and technologies, such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Azure Machine Learning for building and deploying models at scale.



  





**The Role** 




  





 As a Consultant Manager at Northgrounds, you will start with a 50% consultant assignment, transitioning to a full-time role as the team grows. You can be based in central Sweden, but fluency in Swedish is essential
 



  





 You will:
 


* Work closely with clients to understand their business and identify how AI can drive value, leveraging your experience in transforming customers with AI solutions.
* Develop and implement AI strategies that align with client goals, such as deploying advanced analytics for business intelligence or using computer vision for automated inspections.
* Oversee and manage consulting projects from conception through execution, ensuring successful delivery. This includes managing timelines, resources, and stakeholder expectations.
* Mentor senior consultants and junior consultants, contributing to their professional growth and the continuous improvement of our consulting practices.
* Drive sales efforts, working to expand our client base and grow the consulting business.
* Collaborate with a diverse team of experts passionate about making a difference.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 




  




* Experience: Minimum of 5 years in business consulting, with proven success in transforming clients through the implementation of AI solutions.
* Industry Knowledge: Deep understanding of how AI can be applied in various industries such as finance, healthcare, retail, and manufacturing to solve real-world business problems.
* Leadership Skills: Strong leadership and team management skills, with the ability to inspire and guide a team of consultants.
* Sales and Business Development: Experience in driving sales and expanding client relationships, with a track record of meeting sales targets.
* Communication Skills: Ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders, create compelling presentations, and write clear and concise reports.
* Project Management: Experience in managing consulting projects, including scoping, planning, execution, and delivery, with a track record of meeting deadlines and delivering high-quality results.
* Continuous Learning: Passion for staying updated with the latest advancements in AI and continuously improving your skill set.



  





**Join Us** 




  





 If you’re ready to lead and grow AI consulting teams at Northgrounds and have fun doing it, we’d love to hear from you. Apply now and become a part of a team that’s not just building technology but building the future of business

title: Principal, Data & AI
description:
**Join us!** 




 If you’re ready to start the next chapter in your career journey, you’ve come to the right place. We’re always happy to hear from people who are eager to learn and grow, and share our values. Read more about the role and apply.
 



  





 We are searching for an experienced Data & AI expert in our growing Stockholm team. You support our business growth by helping our clients understand the value of their data, translating their business problems into technical needs, delivering diamonds in projects, and by supporting our team growth in skills and team size.
 



  





**About the role** 




 As Data & AI Principal you help our client organisations identify opportunities in leveraging their data to create business value. When an opportunity is found you create an understanding of clients' current state, define an attractive target state, and a plan to get there. As Futurice is known for “talking business and writing code”, we also deliver on those plans with high quality implementations. Typically you lead and work as part of a multidisciplinary team and act as a trusted advisor to our key clients.
 



  





 Our client portfolio is high profile and varying across different industries. We value your previous experience from a wide range of private sector industries and organizations.
 



  





 Your homebase will be in Sweden, ideally Stockholm as your home office. We work mainly remotely, but actively engage with our clients, and also aim to meet as a team on a weekly basis.
 



  





**Our team & projects** 




 We are a data and tech-native, people-centric and outcome focused team. Our projects range from tech (most often also data & AI) advisory engagements to concrete digital solution delivery and typically cover topics like:
 


* Leveraging data, technology & AI for business value
* Building digital products and portfolios
* Generative AI business value exploration and prototyping
* Enterprise Architecture
* Radical process redesign with modern tech



  





**Recipe for success** 




 We re not expecting you to tick all the boxes, but the recipe for success in this role includes:
 


* Around 3-5+ years of experience in either within data management and/or AI
* Understanding of the current data & AI trends
* Industry expertise (we’re not too picky about which industries)
* Understanding of enterprise software and system integration
* Strong knowledge of different cloud platforms
* Data platform architecture and solution architecture know-how
* Ability to lead consulting projects and small teams
* Strong toolbox to help you analyze, structure and present complex client problems
* Suitable higher education degree from e.g. business, tech, industrial or other fields.
* Having a good toolbox of methodologies and frameworks for leveraging data for business value is considered as an advantage
* Earlier experience from sales and creating proposals is considered as an advantage.



  





**Compensation** 




 Your complete compensation package will be discussed in detail during the recruitment process. Our salary model is designed to offer a range of levels based on three factors: skills, responsibilities and impact. We are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and supportive work environment where every employee has the opportunity to thrive and advance in their career and become better versions of themselves.
 



  





 During the initial interview round, we will discuss the salary range for this position. We offer a fixed salary with the possibility of performance-based bonuses and additional benefits.
 



  





**Next steps** 




 Does this sound like the opportunity you’ve been looking for? If yes, that’s great news – please submit your application. If you prefer to work as a freelancer rather than in a company payroll - please let us know, different options are open.
 



  





 Our application form is about as easy as it gets, just enter your contact information and upload your attachments. We’re hoping to see at least your CV and a few lines about yourself and why you want to join Futurice. You’ll also have the option to submit a link to your LinkedIn profile and share other attachments relevant to the application.
 



  





 We will reach out to you as soon as we review your application. The position will be filled when the right candidate is found. Those selected for the interview phase can look forward to an initial discussion, both in order for us to get to know you better, and for you to get more familiar with life at Futurice. That will be followed by an in-depth talk with your potential future colleagues to dive deeper into your professional skills, and finally, one more meeting, where we will focus on a case task.
 



  





**How we work** 




 Ever since Futurice was founded, we’ve been committed to offering a workplace people will genuinely enjoy coming to every morning, Mondays included. We’ve put tons of effort into fostering a healthy and welcoming company culture combined with fair and competitive salaries as well as perks that improve the wellbeing of each Futuricean – take a look here to learn more, check our Culture handbook 2.0 and get to know some of our people through their career stories. Each of our offices also adds its own unique vibe and flavor into the mix. Learn more about our offices here!
 



  





 At Futurice, new joiners are not expected to fit into a specific mold – people are free to come as they are, regardless of their background. We believe there’s power in perspectives and consider diversity an important part of our success. You can learn more about our DE&I commitment and efforts here.
 



  





***We're Futurice***




*We are Futurice, an outcome-focused digital transformation company.We help our clients solve their biggest challenges and empower them to make a positive impact on the world.* 




  





*Founded in 2000, our team comprises over 800 diverse experts who represent more than 60 different nationalities. We have Nordic roots and a global mindset and operate across Europe.*

title: Key Account Manager 🇸🇪
description:
Want to Join Frends Growth Journey? 🚀
   

  

 Frends is growing and we are strengthening our Frends Sweden team. As a result, we´re looking for a new
 **Key Account Manager** 
 .
   

  

**Frends eiPaaS is** 
 our own modern, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller customers and in both private and public sectors in various industries.
 **Frends** 
 is recognized in the
 **Gartner** 
*®* 
**Magic Quadrant™** 
 for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends was also awarded in
 **G2 review** 
 with the "Fastest Implementation", "High Performer" and "Easiest Admin" badges in 2022 and 2023. Our customers give us 4.7 out of 5 stars on Gartner Peer Insights.
   

  

**In this role, you are** 
 responsible for designated customers and growing and developing their solutions to the next level. You work closely with internal stakeholders, such as service and project managers, Frends delivery teams, sales, and management, in order to discover and deliver the best solutions for our customers.
   

  

**🧐** 
 The role includes
   

  

* customer management
* handling all customer and internal communication and cooperation
* responsible for customer revenue and profitability
* upselling and offering new services to customers
* delivery leadership
* leading the customer delivery together with the Frends Delivery organization
* participating in the projects and services steering meetings according to Frends account management model


 🏆 We guarantee
   

  

* low hierarchy and flexible and relaxed organizational culture. Strong team spirit, as well as trust, freedom, and flexibility, are the cornerstones of our culture
* strong, growing market, and strong investments in both our people and product
* the opportunity to work in one of the Nordics' leading and growing integration technology organization and influence our growth journey
* an interesting and responsible role where you can further develop your skills and career
* own, Finnish integration platform Frends which is recognized in the latest Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide.
* flexible working times and hybrid work mode in Sweden
* skilled and supporting co-workers and supervisor
* an employer who supports you in various life situations
* safe, stable, modern, and growing workplace
* competitive salary


**Read from our fresh blog why talents choose Frends and why Frendszies stay with us.**
 🧐 We expect
   

  

* understanding of integration technology, familiarity with SaaS or PaaS solutions
* +3-5 years relevant experience in account management role in the IT sector
* curiosity toward technical solutions
* strong communication skills and business-centric thinking
* ability and willingness to work in fast-paced situations and growing company
* as a person: active, strong communication skills, goal-oriented, committed and responsible, enjoying the low hierarchy culture, and most importantly have an enthusiastic attitude which itself will raise our good team spirit
* fluent in English and Swedish and living in Sweden (visiting our Stockholm office is required on weekly bases)


 ⭐ Interested in joining us?
   

  

 If you want to impact and join our growth journey, please contact us and let us know more about you!
   

  

 We will start going through the applications in the beginning of August.
   

  

**Other related to the job** 
  

  

* The start is flexible according to your situation.
* The position will be filled as soon as the right person is found.
* The salary will be a fixed monthly salary plus a bonus model.
* You will be reporting to Fredrik Wingren, Regional Director, Sweden.
* The role requires fluent Swedish and excellent English and living in Sweden. We support hybrid work mode but also require visiting our Stockholm office on a weekly basis.


 🧐  Want to know more about Frends?
   

  

**Frends** 
 eiPaaS is our own, Nordic, modern, low-code integration platform. Frends solves the digitalization challenges of both global and smaller
 **customers** 
 and in both private and public sectors in various industries. As a brand Frends is over 30 years old but the recent rise of iPaaS Frends has seen explosive growth in the Nordic and Europe markets. It has been and is constantly being developed by our own R&D team. The latest incarnation of the product utilizes modern technologies and cloud services.
   

  

 Visit our
 **we** 
 bpage. Check out our
 **use cases** 
 . Listen to our
 **webi** 
 nars. Learn more about Frendszone from our
 **blogs** 
 .
   

  

 With Frends you get to see the development of the modern enterprise iPaaS platform from various angles. In our wide range portfolio of clients, you can find nationally and internationally known companies across 16 different countries that will lead you to interesting and meaningful projects.
   

  

 Strong team spirit as well as trust, freedom and flexibility are the cornerstones of our culture. Top workmates coupled with challenging and versatile projects with a powerful platform which enables digitalization and process automation – this is Frendszone.
   

  

 Frends is recognized in the latest Gartner® Magic Quadrant™ for Integration Platform as a Service, Worldwide. Frends is also awarded in G2 review with the "Fastest Implementation" badge in 2023.
   

  

 frends.com

title: Systemarkitekt
description:
**Arbetsbeskrivning**
 Till vår kund som är ett modern, Svenskt Green-tech bolag, söker vi nu en Systemarkitekt som tycker om att arbeta med komplexa lösningar tillsammans med andra kompetenta kollegor. Rollen är initialt en konsultroll men förutsatt att det är en god match så önskar kunden att erbjuda en direktanställning hos kundföretaget.
   

  

**Ansvarsområde**
 Du kommer jobba i ett team med System Architect, men dessutom består teamet av experter inom olika områden (DC System Engineer, Control Engineer, Data Scientist, System Test Engineer, mm). Du kommer jobba med t.ex. omvandling av marknads-/produktkrav till system specification och systemarkitektur, med hjälp av t.ex. FMEA:er. I din vardag kommer du jobba tillsammans med/stötta olika team t.ex. produktledning, Quality Assurance, embedded utvecklare, hårdvaruutvecklare.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer**
* Skall:
* Skall ha högskoleutbildning inom Datateknik (BSc.) eller liknande, eller likvärdig arbetslivserfarenhet.
* Proficiency in designing complex systems and architectures.
* Strong knowledge of software development practices and principles.
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
* Effective communication.
* Ha förmågan att designa med testbarhet i åtanke
* Van att jobba med kravspecar (marknads-/produkt- och systemkrav)


**Bör**
* Experience with microservices architecture and API design.
* Familiarity with database management systems and data modeling.
* Erfarenhetskrav (överväg möjligheten att använda både ”skall-krav” och ”bör-krav”)
* Bör ha 3+ erfarenhet av att designa eller 5+ år utveckling inom större system
* Krav på språkfärdigheter (överväg möjligheten att använda både ”skall-krav” och ”bör-krav”):
* Skall kunna engelska (flytande i tal och skrift)
* Bör kunna svenska (flytande i tal och skrift)
* Övriga krav (t.ex. körkort, stilistisk förmåga etc.)
* Bör ha körkort


 Personliga egenskaper
   

  

* Öppen och intresserad person sar lätt att ta sig an svåra problem med ett leende och jobbar pragmatiskt och lösningsorienterad. Du är en lagspelare som har lätt att samarbeta med olika personligheter. Du har ett bra öga för skopning och abstraktionsnivåer – du har lätt för att stycka upp stora problem till mindre delar.

title: Product owner for Production core platform team- Solna/Hybrid
description:
Are you passionate about driving change? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where you can shape the future of logistics and want your parcel to be delivered? Look no further! PostNord, the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions in the Nordic region, is seeking a talented Product owner to join our transformation.
   

  

**Join Us**
 As a Product Owner for the Production Core platform within our organization operating in the production area, you will be responsible for leading the development and enhancement of software solutions focused on managing the shared-service kafka platform, that is going to be used by many teams for exchange of events and orders. Your role will involve collaborating closely with stakeholders, teams, understanding business and the processes, and translating those requirements into a prioritized backlog for the development team. The goal is to ensure the delivery of high-quality, efficient and a stable kafka platform that meet the business and customer needs.
   

  

**Job Duties**
* Lead the Kafka Platform team to ensure seamless integration and operation of the Kafka infrastructure.
* Oversee the development, deployment, and maintenance of Kafka solutions, ensuring they meet business requirements and adhere to industry standards.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, architects, and business stakeholders, to drive the adoption and optimization of Kafka-based solutions.
* Define and prioritize the product backlog, ensuring alignment with the overall business strategy and goals.
* Monitor and report on the performance of the Kafka platform, implementing improvements and ensuring high availability and reliability.


**We are looking for you who have** 
**Need-to-have**
* Proven experience as a Product Owner, Project Manager, or similar role in a technology-driven environment.
* Proactive and self-motivated.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Ability to think strategically and make data-driven decisions.
* Adaptable and open to feedback
* In-depth knowledge of Kafka and its ecosystem, including experience with Kafka Streams, KSQL, and Kafka Connect.
* Strong understanding of data streaming, messaging systems, and real-time data processing.
* Experience with Agile methodologies and tools such as Jira or similar.


**Nice-to-have:**
* Experience in the logistics or supply chain industry.
* Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Knowledge of microservices architecture and containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
* Fluent in Swedish


**Knowledge requirement**
* Certified product owner
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.


**We offer you**
**Benefits**
 We offer a variety of work in an international environment with constantly new challenges and quick decisions. Here you have opportunities to develop creative solutions and work in a prestige-free group where we jointly help to reach our goals. PostNord is one of Sweden's largest workplaces and we offer safe employment conditions and benefits. In addition to the benefits mentioned above, we offer:
   

  

* Hybrid workplace with a Nordic and dynamic environment. Watch the video about our office.
* Great development opportunities
* Great insurance and occupational pension terms
* Wellness allowance & opportunity to train at Arken's gym and indoor swimming pool
* Employee benefits through PostNord Plus - PostNord´s own personnel foundation


**We make everyday life easier**
 PostNord is the leading supplier of communication and logistics solutions to, from, and within the Nordic region. We ensure the provision of a postal service to households and businesses in Sweden and Denmark. We aim to make everyday life easier and more sustainable for everyone who lives and works in the Nordic region. We are in a constant transformation and work consistently to develop both our offer and our employees, all to achieve our vision of being The favorite carrier of the Nordics. We are PostNord - a fantastic company to work and grow with. Read more at postnord.com
   

  

**Apply**
 We look forward to receive your application!
   

  

 If you have any questions or concerns, please contact manager Carolina Lunde on: carolina.lunde@postnord.com
   

  

 Don't wait to submit your application as we go through the applications on an ongoing basis.
   

  

 For union representatives, visit: Union contact
   

  

 We are looking forward to hear from you!
   

  

 = job published as hybrid

title: Salesforce Consultant
description:
Axenon is a Nordic Salesforce partner and a member of the North Alliance family, the Nordic region's largest agency network in design, technology and communication. Our mission is to empower organizations with tailored Salesforce solutions that align perfectly with our clients unique business processes, challenges, and objectives.
 



  





 As a Salesforce Consultant, you will collaborate with Axenon's project managers within business development and the successful adoption and implementation of the Salesforce platform. This role requires a deep understanding of both the technical capabilities of Salesforce and the strategic objectives of the business, ensuring that the solutions devised are not only effective but also aligned with the broader goals of the organization.
 



  





**Additionally, you will** 



* Support business development activities.
* Identify customer needs by working with both internal and external teams.
* Engage in pre-sales discovery, documenting both business and functional requirements.
* Provide consulting to clients on cloud architecture.
* Lead business process review sessions to identify user stories/requirements and conceptualize solution designs based on best practices and client needs.
* Ensure optimal use and adherence to best practices across various clouds.
* Utilize standard Salesforce configuration to meet client requirements.
* Perform analysis, cleansing, and insertion of data.



  





**Our offer to you** 




 Joining Axenon, you become an integral part of a vibrant company of about fifty professionals, including project managers, Salesforce consultants, and developers. Our team comes from varied backgrounds and industries. Together, we meet challenges, create solutions and achieve digital changes that have a major and meaningful impact for our clients.
 



  





**In addition to excellent colleagues** 



* Enjoy the comfort and inspiration of working in a contemporary office located at Tulegatan , designed to foster creativity and collaboration.
* We invest in you from day one, offering personalized, fully-sponsored Salesforce certification programs to deepen your expertise and enhance your credentials.
* Your professional development is important. We provide a wide range of educational opportunities and resources within your field, ensuring you're always on the cutting edge and ready for the next step in your career.



  





**Who are you?** 




 We are seeking an individual who not only brings extensive experience in consultancy within relevant fields such as technical consultant or business analytics but also possesses a track record of successful engagements and a deep understanding of client needs in various industries.
 



  





**You probably recognize yourself in the following** 



* 1-2+ years' hands-on expertise in Salesforce implementations and configurations.
* Experience implementing several Salesforce Cloud solutions such as Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, or Marketing Cloud and understands their application to business needs.
* Good expertise in crafting Flows to automate processes within the Salesforce platform, along with a solid understanding of how to utilize APEX code to build triggers/batchers for internal or external processes interfacing with other systems’ APIs
* Proficient in articulating technical Salesforce solutions to non-technical stakeholders.
* Understand on a conceputal / process level how to utilize Visualforce, Lightning Components, and Salesforce APIs for custom development and integration
* Skilled in Salesforce data migration and data quality management, ensuring accuracy and integrity of data within Salesforce environments.
* University degree within a relevant IT field such as computer science or information technology.
* Proficient in Swedish.



  





**Next step** 




 You do not need to send a personal letter or CV document to apply. We want to make it easy for you to show your interest - so all we need is for you to enter a link to your Linkedin profile.

title: CRM System Owner
description:
Voyado is a fast-growing Swedish SaaS company, trusted by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide to deliver exceptional customer experiences. As we expand internationally, we are driven by our vision to become Europe’s leading customer experience solution in the retail sector. With over 300 passionate Voyadoers, we are on an exciting growth journey—and we want you to join us!
   

  

**About The Role**
 Are you a dynamic and detail-oriented CRM enthusiast ready to take ownership of our Salesforce platform? We're looking for someone like you to manage, optimize, and elevate our Salesforce system, ensuring it aligns seamlessly with our business goals. You'll play a critical role in supporting our teams, driving efficiency, and ensuring compliance across the board. Your expertise will be key to keeping our Salesforce system at peak performance, helping us maintain our competitive edge in the market.
   

  

 Some of the things you'll be up to:
   

  

* CRM Management and Configuration: Take the lead on configuring and continuously optimizing our Salesforce CRM. Ensure it meets the evolving needs of all user groups while supporting our strategic business objectives.
* Stakeholder Engagement: Serve as the primary point of contact for Salesforce, managing communication with external consultants and internal stakeholders to ensure alignment with our business strategies.
* License Management and Compliance: Oversee Salesforce license agreements, including negotiations, approvals, and inventory management, to ensure compliance and resource efficiency.
* Training and Support: Conduct training sessions with internal stakeholders and Salesforce users. You'll ensure everyone follows best practices and maximizes the system's potential.


**The employment will initially be a temporary position until March 2026, but there is a chance of permanent employment.**
 So, who are you?
   

  

 We're looking for a proactive CRM professional who’s excited to take ownership of our Salesforce system. As the go-to person for all Salesforce-related questions, you’ll need a strong understanding of CRM best practices and a consultative, service-minded approach.
   

  

*Skills & background:*
* Proven experience as a system administrator for a CRM system; Salesforce experience is highly preferred.
* Proficiency in CRM configurations, best practices, and the ability to create and deliver effective training sessions.
* A consultative mindset, with the ability to advise and support colleagues on best practices.
* Strong organizational skills, with the ability to prioritize and plan your work effectively.
* Fluency in English is required; Swedish is a big plus.


 What's in it for you?
   

  

 Voyado wouldn’t be the powerful platform we are without the people behind them. We really care for our Voyadoers and some examples of what we can offer you are:
   

  

* An engaged team with a knowledge-sharing and friendly culture
* Summits on a regular basis where we hang out, workshop, discuss, and have a good time together
* Opportunity to engage and deepen your knowledge in different initiatives
* Work-life balance – we don't have a long work-hours culture, we value engagement over hours worked


 Being personal extends into everything about Voyado, read more on what it is like to work at Voyado here.
   

  

*Some of our benefits:*
* 30 days of vacation, so you can spend time on the things you love
* Beneficial bike lease, including e-bikes
* Breakfast buffet on Fridays
* Your choice of phone and gadget package
* 5000 SEK in wellness allowance
* A wellness hour a week


****More on Voyado!****
 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. We empower retailers and e-commerce companies to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their businesses. We are a purpose-driven company where every opinion is valued, and every team member has the opportunity to make a meaningful impact. At Voyado, you’ll work in a self-driven environment with strong support from your team.
   

  

****Be yourself 🏳️‍🌈****
 At Voyado, we believe in gender equality. We are proud sponsors of Womengineer as well as Tjejer Kodar! Read more about Tjejer Kodar & Voyado here
   

  

  

  

 Equality is not only about gender but also about making everyone feel welcome and heard in a multicultural and diverse environment. We at Voyado strive to make everyone feel like they can bring their true self to work every day. Gender-equal and diverse teams have more perspectives on life and bring different ideas to the table which in the end leads not only to making a better working environment but also a better product.
   

  

 Ready to find out more?
   

  

 Lovely! 🎉
   

  

*Before one applies it can always feel like you need a better resume, more polish, or just another year of experience, but we say if you think this sounds like a place where you can shine don't hesitate to send in your resume!*
 We'd love to get to know you and understand what makes you tick, so write a few lines about what you enjoy about your current role and what would be an exciting challenge for you in the future. We are eager to get to know you and what you love to do, so be yourself and let your passion shine through in your application!
   

  

 Voyado is the ultimate solution for personalization and relevance across all channels—online and offline. Used by retailers and e-commerce companies worldwide, the Voyado customer experience cloud makes it possible for every brand to engage customers, elevate shopping experiences, and evolve their own businesses.

title: SAP SuccessFactors Sales Executive
description:
**SAP SuccessFactors Sales Executive** 




*Nordics based (hybrid working)* 




  





 Empiric is partnering with a dominant force within the SAP space globally, with a strong footprint in the Nordics especially. They wish to grow their sales division to the next level, generate new business opportunities, and secure new projects across SuccessFactors alongside other SAP offerings.
 



  





 They have an exceptional SAP and SAP SuccessFactors delivery practice that can successfully provide solutions to customers, with the necessary funding and resource allocation to make this a success. Now, their priority is to engage and acquire more net new customers and grow their business revenues.
 



  





*What's in it for you?* 



* Work within a globally recognized employer, known for its exceptional SAP talent and presence.
* Work with household-name customers and engage with senior leaders within these businesses.
* Lots of possibilities to grow internally, towards team leadership, or individual contributor paths depending on your motivations.
* Collaborate with some of the best sales professionals across Europe



  





*Why are you suitable?* 



* Experienced in acquiring new customers to deliver SAP and SuccessFactors projects, particularly across the Nordics.
* You have established a valuable and strong network of key decision-makers within the space, having great relationships with both vendors and customers.
* Proven success in delivering significant revenues and sales figures.
* Nordic language fluency is desirable



  





 For more information and a confidential conversation, apply now.
 



  





*Empiric Solutions Empiric is a dynamic technology and transformation recruitment agency specializing in data, digital, cloud, and security. We supply technology and change recruitment services to businesses looking for both contract and permanent professionals globally.*

title: Account Manager till Varnish Software
description:
Drömmer du om att driva försäljning och bygga starka kundrelationer inom den digitala världen? Varnish Software söker en engagerad Account Manager till deras team i Stockholm. Bli en del av deras resa och revolutionera webbprestanda!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Varnish Software AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 Försäljning
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Som Account Manager på Varnish Software kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i att driva nyförsäljning och vårda befintliga kundrelationer inom Norden. Dina huvudsakliga ansvarsområden inkluderar att identifiera och förvärva nya kunder, hantera SME- och stora konton samt nå tydliga försäljningsmål. Du kommer att resa för att träffa kunder och samarbeta med ett dedikerat team för att leverera exceptionella lösningar inom innehållsleverans.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Ett utmanande jobb med möjligheter till personlig utveckling.
  
* Balans mellan arbete och privatliv med möjlighet att anpassa arbetstider efter dina behov.
  
* En spännande och utvecklande arbetsmiljö.
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Hantera och utveckla relationer med befintliga kunder för att säkerställa tillfredsställelse och lojalitet.
  
* Driva försäljningen mot specifika mål och kvoter.
  
* Leda försäljningsprocessen från prospektering till avslut.
  
* Genomföra regelbundna kundmöten och presentationer.
  
* Samarbeta med tvärfunktionella team, inklusive Solutions Engineers och Deployment Engineers.
  
* Övervaka marknadstrender och konkurrentaktiviteter för att identifiera nya affärsmöjligheter.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Gedigen erfarenhet av försäljning, specifikt inom SME- och stora konton.
  
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att leda försäljningsprocesser från start till mål.
  
* Självdriven och affärsinriktad, med starka organisatoriska färdigheter.
  
* Erfarenhet av komplex programvaruförsäljning, helst inom fintech-sektorn.
  
* Flytande i svenska och engelska; andra nordiska språk är meriterande.
  
* Möjlighet att resa för kundmöten.
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Målmedveten
  
* Social
  
* Ordningsam
  
* Ansvarstagande
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Varnish Software AB**

 Varnish Software är en ledande leverantör av avancerade lösningar för webbacceleration och innehållsleverans. Deras innovativa teknik hjälper företag världen över att förbättra webbplatsens prestanda, förbättra användarupplevelsen och effektivt skala sin digitala närvaro. Med en mängd produkter och tjänster, inklusive Varnish Cache, Varnish Enterprise och Varnish Controller, möjliggör de för organisationer att leverera blixtsnabb innehållsleverans, minska serverbelastningen och hantera hög trafikvolym enkelt.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Varnish Software AB**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv3@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106359

title: SAP Sales Executive - Eviden
description:
Eviden is an Atos Group business with an annual revenue of circa € 5 billion and a global leader in data-driven, trusted and sustainable digital transformation. As a next generation digital business with worldwide leading positions in digital, cloud, data, advanced computing and security, it brings deep expertise for all industries in more than 47 countries. By uniting unique high-end technologies across the full digital continuum with 55,000 world-class talents, Eviden expands the possibilities of data and technology, now and for generations to come.
   

  

 We are looking to hire SAP Sales Executive with an understanding of both business processes and SAP technologies who is sales-minded with a Can-do attitude. Does that sound like an exciting new opportunity for you? If yes, do not hesitate to apply and become part of our fantastic team!
   

  

**Your Responsibilities Will Include**
 Customer relationship management up to CxO level across the region for key clients.
   

  

 Will work closely with the SAP Alliance team to build Atos’ brand as a partner and ensure this becomes a viable and productive route to market and business development channel.
   

  

 Work to improve our local brand regarding SAP and build a reputation as an innovative market leader.
   

  

 Drive growth trajectory for SAP practice in the region by proactively pushing and ensuring cross-selling, upselling, and fertilization.
   

  

 Ensure additional client demands are translated into agreed service improvements: identify, pursue, and on occasions personally close strategically meaningful contract opportunities.
   

  

 Handle renewal of existing contracts in line with Market Sales.
   

  

 Support the planning and development of key accounts in coordination with Sales.
   

  

 Making sure that we are well placed to win large, sophisticated work with enterprise clients as well as maintaining the current footprint in the market.
   

  

 Work with the Head of Operations for Vertical and Practice to ensure contracts and services are delivered
   

  

 As crafted and remain adapted to customer business. Ensure customer delight and act as a point of escalation when required.
   

  

 Drive transition towards an increased offshore delivery model within the BU, including working with the works councils.
   

  

 Accountable for achieving maximum profitability within scope.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Innovation-oriented regarding SAP, with a proven track record of working on S4/HANA and Cloud transformations, across the full core ERP suite. Able to credibly build and explain cases for this type of work to senior Client partners across business and IT.
* Industry experience -Manufacturing, Supply Chain, and Industry 4.0.
* Experience with the integration of core SAP modules into other areas (e.g. C4, Ariba, Azure, etc.) would be desirable.
* Expertise in service delivery, costing, handling partner concerns, and crisis management within a dynamic and multifaceted delivery organization.
* Commercial competence around effectively running sales pipelines, including knowledge of how best to channel time and resources, how to advise Client Leaders and support them in growing existing accounts, and how to bring in new logo accounts.
* Strong personal networks in the enterprise space; A hands-on leader who can be a difference maker in the room with C-level client partners.
* Significant exposure to working in an international environment, with an understanding of cultural sensitivities across multiple geographies. This should include considerable experience with offshore models.
* Strong technical judgment with technical experience in the past - comfortable getting into the details when vital.
* Open to travel.
* Local Language is an advantage and English is a must.


****What we offer:****
 Besides an exciting and welcoming working environment with global and local people, we offer you:
   

  

* Driven and competitive remuneration package.
* A casual work environment with highly experienced colleagues;
* Good benefits package, flexible pension
* Extensive training programs.
* Flexible working schedule.


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

**#Eviden**
**Let’s grow together.**

title: Senior Mobile Developer
description:
*Länsförsäkringar söker dig som vill vara med när vi etablerar en organisation som ska göra oss till en ledande aktör inom utveckling. Här kommer du få jobba i en inkluderande och varm miljö med drivna kollegor, samt får möjlighet att jobba inom ett av de största bolagen inom bank och försäkringsbranschen.*
*Vi söker just nu en Senior Apputvecklare. Är du social och kommunikativ och gärna kommer med nya idéer? Då kan du vara den vi söker!*
**Om jobbet**
 Dagarna startar oftast med en standup tillsammans med ditt team. Teamet planerar, prioriterar, genomför och utvärderar löpande sina sprintar. Som utvecklare ligger din huvudfokus på att designa, implementera nya funktioner, felsöka problem, förbättra kod och viss mån att hantera incidenter. Vi eftersträvar gärna att du som teammedlem utvecklas/breddar din kunskap inom flera områden för att få en s.k. T-profil.
   

  

 Som Apputvecklare kommer du att spela en central roll i att utveckla och förbättra våra mobilapplikationer. Du kommer att arbeta i nära samarbete med vårt teknikteam och vara ansvarig för att skapa högkvalitativa och användarvänliga appfunktioner som möter våra kunders förväntningar. Du kommer att ingå i ett app team som arbetar enligt SAFe samt använder MS Azure DevOps.
   

  

 Tillsammans med dina kollegor i Sverige siktar du på att utveckla nya tjänster och utöka plattformen med nya funktioner och säkerställa att våra får en kundupplevelse i världsklass.
   

  

**Vem är du?**
 Vi söker dig som har arbetat som Apputvecklare i minst 5 år i projekt kopplade till iOS eller Android utveckling. Du har erfarenhet av tvärfunktionella team och är van att ta ett helhetsgrepp om utvecklingsprocessen. Du kommunicerar flytande på både svenska och engelska.
   

  

 Vi ser att du behärskar en eller flera tekniker och språk bl.a Swift, Objective-C, Xcode , Kotlin och Java.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet av något/några frontramverk, arkitektur inom Azure och CI/CD inom Azure DevOps.
* Erfarenhet av dependency injection, unit testing och CI/CD
* Erfarenhet av SAFe Framework för att säkerställa Agil utveckling och kontinuerlig förbättring
* Ett genuint intresse för användarupplevelse och design, med möjlighet att bidra till att förbättra den digitala kundupplevelsen.
* Erfarenhet av apputveckling native iOS under minst 5 år
* Erfarenhet av apputveckling native Android under minst 5 år
* Erfarenhet av cross plattform såsom Flutter, React Native


 Som person tror vi att du är social och kommunikativ och gärna kommer med nya idéer i gruppforum. Du stimuleras utav att ha en inverkan på din miljö och driver arbetet framåt. I kombination med detta är du ödmjuk och försöker lyfta fram andra i din närhet.
   

  

 För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du är en nyfiken och engagerad person som älskar problemlösning. Du är en lagspelare och tycker om att samarbeta i en mångkulturell miljö. Vi ser att du bidrar till vår kultur med öppenhet, tilltro till kollegor och glädje inför det dagliga arbetet.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Välkommen till enheten Digital & IT! Hos oss får du chansen att göra skillnad och utvecklas genom att skapa teknologier som förenklar den pågående omvärldstransformationen och ökar digitaliseringen för Länsförsäkringar och våra kunder. Du kommer till ett dynamiskt team som värdesätter mångfald högt - här är du välkommen oavsett kön, social bakgrund och ålder.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag.*
**På grund av semesterperiod kan det ta längre tid att få återkoppling på din ansökan. Tack för din förståelse**
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2024-09-11**

title: SAP S4 HANA Solution Architect
description:
**Employment Type:** 
 Permanent
 



**Working Model:** 
 Hybrid (1-2 days onsite-flexible)
 



**Travel:** 
 Candidate should be open to business travel within/outside EU occasionally.
 



  





**About Wipro SAP Practice:** 




 Wipro enables global enterprises to standardize, automate, accelerate, and experience by harnessing the power of cloud and digital technologies. With over 25+ years of experience in handling complex SAP engagements and being a Global Strategic Services Partner (GSSP) with SAP, Wipro is uniquely positioned to offer cutting edge and transformative solutions to our customers through multiple joint co-innovation programs. We provide a host of services across SAP consulting, SAP implementation and SAP managed services leveraging our 360o relationship with SAP.
 



 Wipro has gained extensive capability on SAP with over 17,000+ SAP resources working for 400+ global customers in over 70 locations. We have more than 8700+ SAP certified consultants, and Wipro is ranked #5 in the industry for total SAP certifications.
 



 With over 22 SAP S/4 HANA innovation centers and studios around the globe, Wipro has built over 60 intelligent technology accelerators, preconfigured solutions, and proprietary tools to help organizations become future-ready. Wipro’s eSymphony is a unique platform that enables enterprises to chart a digital transformation enabling a ‘vision-to-value’ perspective build on a wide range of components including across industry centric insights, business process intelligence and platform integration that helps achieve through a cloud-first strategies.
 



 The acquisition of rising, a global consulting SAP firm, has strengthened our strategic SAP consulting capabilities in a critical expansion of Wipro Enterprise Futuring division.
 



  





**Key requirements and key responsibilities:** 



* Define strategy for deal structuring (together with Pursuit lead), create win themes and identify relevant artefacts to support in winning
 **SAP S4 HANA** 
 -led transformation deals.
* Take an active role in customer meetings to understand business context, IT landscape, business and technical requirements. Thereafter, play a key role in driving the SAP solution strategy and creating win themes mapped to client’s business requirements.
* Lead and own end-to-end
 **SAP solution development** 
 – architect and orchestrate solution development by working with Sales, solution leads and delivery teams to offer the best value proposition from Wipro – Key themes include S/4HANA
 **Transformation Programs** 
 , SAP Cloud Migrations, Managed Services/ Vendor Consolidation of Managed Servies, SAP Upgrades including Cloud related offerings.
* Creating solutions for both proactive pitches and RFI/RFP responses for SAP S4 HANA pursuits. Where required, this role will require discussions and meetings with alliance partners and third-party vendors.
* Actively involve and support the sales teams in demand creation activities by attending customer or prospect meetings to present Wipro’s SAP capabilities and delivery approach
* Attend proposal presentation meetings with customers and prospects to present and discuss suggested SAP solutions.
* Involve in the initial solution design and workshops to transition the solution to the delivery team.
* Ability to adapt in a rapidly changing environment, work effectively under high pressure, growth mode.
* Prior experience in a highly collaborative and matrixed environment or any experience with a Global Delivery Model based IT Services Company will be an added advantage.



  





**Skills:** 



* 15+ Years of SAP Architecting and implementation experiences and actively involved in the Sales Cycle in building solutions and propositions in the SAP Services & Consulting industry.
* Experience in large scale transformation programs from a sales and steering perspective, capable of high level solutioning and sizing.
* At least one strong horizontal (finance, supply chain, ...) and deep knowledge in one industry (preferred manufacturing).
* This role would require someone with intimate understanding of SAP solutions and their deployment approaches. Hence, candidates that have prior experience in SAP pre-sales / SAP sales cycles and leading / senior architecture roles on 5+ SAP projects will be a pre-requisite.
* Strong expertise with one or more SAP functional module (SAP FICO/ Logistics/ Procurement.)
* Strong understanding of SAP solutions and their application across various industries. Focus industries in Northern Europe for Wipro include Manufacturing, Consumer or ENU industry segments.
* Strong experience of solution design within
 **SAP S/4HANA Implementation** 
 / Rollout/ Conversion, Central Finance, Digital Supply Chain.
* Experience in SAP Public Cloud and
 **IT transformation, Digital and Business Transformation** 
 experience is preferred.
* Excellent customer interface skills – communication & ability to deliver presentations, drive meetings. Develop long term valued relationships with the client. Building and maintaining strong client relationships.

title: Pega Lead System Architect to Know Your Customer
description:
**Req ID: 22838**




  
 





**Pega Lead System Architect to Know Your Customer, Group Business Support** 






  
 





 We are looking for an experienced Pega Lead System Architect to join Group business support on our new strategic KYC journey with Pega CLM/KYC.
 





  
 





 In today’s world, change is the one thing you can count on. But whatever the future brings, our customers remain at the heart of everything we do. At Nordea, we’re committed to dynamically fight against international financial crime by using the latest technologies and processes. You will play a part in building a better bank that fulfills a meaningful role in society. So bring your ideas, skills and unique background. You’ll be in good company with plenty of opportunities to collaborate, grow and make your mark on something bigger.
 





  
 





**About this opportunity** 






  
 





 As a Pega Lead System Architect in Group business support focused on Know Your Customer and Pega CLM/KYC, you will play a pivotal role in creating tangible value towards Nordea’s mission of detecting and preventing financial crime, by leading and driving scope definitions, requirements analysis, functional and technical design to ensure minimal unjustified deviation from OOTB. In addition you will support in shaping the Global KYC Tool roadmap.
 





  
 





**What you’ll be doing:** 





* Lead the functional and technical design for Pega CLM/KYC to ensure minimal OOTB deviation and maximize inheritance across epics
* Shape the future Pega CLM/KYC roadmap
* Support in scoping and sizing new Epics
* Configure and support the maintenance of Pega CLM/KYC
* Be a Pega development SME and lead development teams to deliver according to roadmap



  
 





**Who you are** 






  
 





 Collaboration. Ownership. Passion. Courage. These are the values that guide us in being at our best – and that we imagine you share with us. 
 





  
 





**To succeed in this role, we believe that you:** 





* Have solid hands-on Pega development experience with exposure to the strategic Pega CLM/KYC application
* Keep update on the latest Pega CLM/KYC functional releases
* Agile/Scrum development methodology knowledge/experience
* Have knowledge on a variety of technologies, including but not limited to including WebShere or Weblogic, J2EE (JSP, Servlets, EJB, XML, Java), .Net, Oracle, DB2, KAFKA and MS SQL.
* A interest of training and mentoring colleagues in Pega CLM/KYC
* Have strong stakeholder management skills



  
 





**Your experience and background:** 





* Pega LSA certification
* 7+ years as a Pegasystems certified Lead System Architect, actively working with Pega in the role of Lead System Architect
* 2+ years actively working with Pega CLM/KYC
* 3+ years Java/J2EE development experience
* Experience leading a team of Pega System Architects in a project/agile team
* Fluent in English (professional level)



  
 





 If this sounds like you, get in touch!
 





  
 





**Next steps** 






  
 





 Submit your application no later than 31/10/2024.
 





  
 





 At Nordea, we know that an inclusive workplace is a sustainable workplace. We deeply believe that our diverse backgrounds, experiences, characteristics and traits make us better at serving customers and communities. So please come as you are.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Sweden:** 
 For union information, please contact finansforbundet@nordea.se or SACONordea@nordea.com.
 





  
 





**Only for candidates in Poland:** 
 Please include permit for processing personal data in CV as following: 
 





  
 





 In accordance with art. 6 (1) a and b. Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation) hereinafter ‘GDPR’. I agree to have: my personal data, education and employment history proceeded for the purposes of current and future recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. 
 





  
 





 The administrator of your personal data is: Nordea Bank Abp operating in Poland through its Branch, address: Aleja Edwarda Rydza Śmiglego 20, 93-281 Łodź. Your personal data will be processed for the recruitment processes in Nordea Bank Abp. You have a right to access your personal data, right to rectify and right to delete. Disclosing the personal data in the scope specified by the provisions of Polish Labour Code from 26 June 1974 and executive acts are mandatory. Providing personal data is necessary to conduct the recruitment processes. The request for the deletion of your personal data means resignation from further participation in recruitment processes and causes the immediate removal of your application. Detailed information concerning processing of your personal data can be found at: https://www.nordea.com/en/doc/nordea-privacy-policy-for-applicants.pdf.
 





  
 





 We reserve the right to reply only to selected applications.

title: Revenue Accounting Manager - Software Industry, IFRS 15, NetSuite
description:
Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. We are also a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.
   

  

 The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring a
 **Revenue Accounting Manager,** 
 ideally a candidate with a passion for systems accounting, to drive revenue recognition process, decisions, systems and reporting.
   

  

 In our finance function we aspire to set the industry pace for speed and accuracy of reporting. We aim to achieve this by driving our product pricing and terms, contracting, sales processes and systems into alignment.
   

  

 We are looking for a
 **professionally qualified accounting leader with expertise in IFRS 15/ASC 606** 
 to build scalable contract review and revenue recognition processes. This lead will work across teams including product management, legal, FP&A, sales operations and commercial business systems to align understanding and ensure that the accounting and revenue recognition treatment of contracts and products is straightforward and correct, with a very high level of automation. Perhaps unusually we
 **prefer a leader with deep personal interest in the software and technology industry, and ideally some data analytics and software engineering experience** 
 . The Revenue Accounting Manager will ensure the proper application of revenue accounting guidance for public market scrutiny. Ideally they will also be familiar with Systems Accounting and able to work effectively with technical teams and software engineers.
   

  

 This is a management position which requires confidence in presentation, setting goals, and directing the work of others. We expect to grow a team focused on revenue, with a particular emphasis on systems and automation, that puts us at the top of the leaderboard for clarity, correctness, transparency and speed of reporting as a global tech company.
   

  

**Location:** 
 This role is home-based in EMEA time zones, with the option to be based in our London office. It will report to our Global Head of Accounting.
   

  

 Key responsibilities
   

  

* Collaborate with Product Management, Sales Operations, Sales, Legal, and FP&A teams to design standard contracts
* Drive process and configuration improvements in NetSuite and related systems for end-to-end automation of the revenue life cycle
* Incorporate industry best practices and emerging technology to raise the bar for reporting speed and accuracy
* Review and evaluate the revenue recognition impact of non-standard contracts and new products
* Lead, mentor and develop a team of revenue accounting and systems accounting professionals
* Assist in month-end revenue close, including reconciliations, fluctuation analysis, and other reporting
* Develop and maintain effective internal over revenue transactions and reporting
* Research and write accounting memos on significant revenue recognition and other policy matters
* Act as the primary liaison with external auditors in matters related to order-to-cash


**Valued Skills And Experience**
* An exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
* An undergraduate degree in Accounting or Finance, or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
* CPA, CA or equivalent with excellent technical accounting skills and IFRS experience
* A detailed understanding of IFRS 15 and relevant rules related to SaaS and services
* Leadership or management responsibility
* A track record of going above-and-beyond expectations
* Experience of software licensing, subscription and services revenue accounting and operations
* Experience driving revenue recognition and scaling accounting processes in a high-growth environment
* Experience with ERP, Rev Rec, CRM, CPQ and other relevant software categories - NetSuite and Salesforce preferred
* Experience in a multi-country multi-currency, operations and tax environment
* Professional written and spoken English
* Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
* Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
* Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
* Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long


**Additional, Optional Skills We Value**
* Public company reporting and revenue accounting experience
* Software implementation, integration and user acceptance
* Software engineering qualification or experience
* A passion for technology and a desire to work with motivated colleagues
* MBA or other relevant business degree


 What we offer you
   

  

 We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
   

  

* Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
* Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year
* Annual compensation review
* Recognition rewards
* Annual holiday leave
* Maternity and paternity leave
* Employee Assistance Programme
* Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues
* Priority Pass, and travel upgrades for long haul company events


**About Canonical**
 Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
   

  

 Canonical is an equal opportunity employer
   

  

 We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

title: E-mobility Engineer
description:
I am Oskar, your potential next leader and a veteran in the context of Vasaloppet, 11, and still going strong! For me, engineering has been the most interesting when I have had projects and problems to solve with all the different parts of a product. I love to work in the area where software and hardware meet, and the most fun is when it contributes to a better society. You will enjoy being a part of my team if you like the freedom to try new assignments and technologies and want to create products. My leadership style is to help you grow in the pace and direction that you would like. That is also why I chose to join Knightec from the beginning!

**Why working as a consultant will fit you**
--------------------------------------------


Because you want to focus on solving technical problems without internal politics, you want to make new products that last, not handling the old legacy. And you want to have a team with engineers who understand the problem you meet and help you see them from another perspective.

**What will you work with?**
----------------------------


For the transportation sector, electrification is the paradigm shift of the century. As an engineer within e-Mobility at Knightec, you could drive the change.


The required areas of expertise within electromobility cover a broad spectrum, and where you want to contribute is up to you. Whether you are skilled in Systems engineering, Embedded software development, Control systems design, or Test and verification, your knowledge will be valuable.


We believe that a holistic approach is required to make products and services succeed both now and in the future. Our way of working is in cross-functional teams closely collaborating with our customers.

**What you need to bring**
--------------------------


Our best guess is that you have an educational background in mechatronics, electronics, computer science, or software engineering with an interest in electrification and/or the automotive industry.


Electrification consist of a variety of building blocks, and we think you have competence and experience from one or several of the following:

* *Electric motors*
* *Inverters*
* *Battery technology*
* *Battery Management Systems*
* *Charging*

More specifically, we are looking for skilled people whose key competencies lie within any of the following fields:

* *Systems Engineering*
* *Embedded software development (Matlab Simulink, C, C++)*
* *Electronics design*
* *Control systems design*
* *Test and verification*

**Knightec**
------------


We are consultants in technology, digitalization, and leadership. We work to improve people's lives through game-changing solutions. We are engineers focusing on product development that should be sustainable and durable in edge technology in both in-house projects and at customer sites. We are more than 900 engineers in 10 different cities. To be a consultant at Knightec isn't just a job; it is the way to build a career that you can be proud of!

title: Functional Safety Engineer at Electromobility
description:
Are you passionate about creating a safer world and willing to go the extra mile to deliver first class sustainable transportation? Our shared innovations will reshape the cities of tomorrow, lower the carbon footprint, and contribute to a clean future. You will be the driver of our safety culture, securing safety in electronic and software systems. Does it sound interesting? Then apply already today!

 **About the team and role**  

We at Electric Propulsion Architecture are a team of skilled engineers building complete system solutions for Electric drivelines. We work on cutting-edge electromobility projects and believe that great innovations come through cooperation and are always there to give a helping hand when needed.  

Here, you will work with Functional Safety, and requirements on our electric driveline, driving the safety aspects and supporting your colleagues as an expert. By playing such an important role in the company’s safety culture and electromobility development, you will be a key contributor to achieving the company targets.  

  

**About you**  

We are now looking for an additional Functional Safety Engineer with experience from electric drivelines, that can implement the safety standards into our organization.  

  

**To succeed in this role, you will require:**  

* Min. six years experienced in working as a Functional Safety Engineer, with item definition, hazard analysis and development of safety concepts.
* Ability to lead and influence cross-functional team members without direct authority.
* Good knowledge of the ISO26262 standard.
* Ability to break down our safety related top level requirements to our electronics, hardware and software design.
* Work with suppliers to ensure that their deliverables fulfil the correct level of safety requirements.
* M.Sc. in Electrical engineering, Mechatronics or similar.
* Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
* Familiar with application software and automotive communications protocols.
* Knowledge in Cybersecurity, ISO/SAE 2143, is meritorious.


  

**Any questions? Contact me!**  

Conny Nicander, Group Manager Electric Propulsion Architecture, conny.nicander@volvo.com  

Kindly note that due to GDPR, we will not accept applications via mail. Please use our career site.  

Last Date to Apply: September 10, 2024  

Number of Vacancies: 2

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination.  

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join Volvo Group. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.  

  

**Group Trucks Technology** are seeking talents to help design sustainable transportation solutions for the future. As part of our team, you’ll help us by engineering exciting next-gen technologies and contribute to projects that determine new, sustainable solutions. Bring your love of developing systems, working collaboratively, and your advanced skills to a place where you can make an impact. Join our design shift that leaves society in good shape for the next generation.

title: Expert System Design Engineer/Architect, Electromobility
description:
Transport is at the core of modern society. Imagine using your expertise to shape sustainable transport solutions for the future? If you seek to make a difference on a global scale, working with next-gen technologies and the sharpest collaborative teams, then we could be a perfect match.

 **What you will do**  

Electromobility is one of the main development areas within Volvo Group and is at the forefront of environmentally friendly transport solutions for a more sustainable tomorrow. We are responsible for the transition from conventional powertrains to electromobility and to secure a stepwise implementation in different segments/regions. We develop and drive the electromobility product portfolio for Trucks and Buses as well as create opportunities for all business areas within Volvo Group. Electromobility is a growing organization in place to shape the future! At Electric Propulsion Architecture we are responsible to develop complete Electric Driveline Systems to be realized by hardware and software solutions.

  

Your responsibilities will include requirement specifications, collecting and breakdown of requirements. Working together with technology teams and system teams to define the system design to meet the requirements. Balancing of the technical solution and support for verification. Involving in the technical decisions towards projects and suppliers, making sure that we continuously improve quality.

 **Who are you?**  

We believe that to be successful in this position, you are a pragmatic team player that loves to develop system designs with the customer in focus. Since the area is in an early phase, it is important that you are flexible and enjoy working in a changing environment. You have a broad knowledge and experience of both HW and SW domains. Confident in leading system solution towards suppliers and product teams. We also believe that you feel comfortable of owning and taking responsibility of your system and do so with great attitude.  

  

**Relevant Experience**  

* 5 years of experience from System design/architecture within automotive systems.
* Ability to find solutions across domains on complicated topics.
* Experience from development within Electrical Propulsion System.
* Experience in defining requirement and balancing requirement between stakeholders and technical solution.
* Master degree in Mechatronics, Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or similar.
  

Feel free to reach out if you have any questions!  

Conny Nicander, Manager Electric Propulsion Architecture, conny.nicander@volvo.com  

Zahra Zafar, Talent Aquisition Partner, zahra.zafar@consultant.volvo.com


We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.
